racecards.race_name: Prix de Fontainebleau (Group 3) (3yo Colts & Geldings) (Grande Course) (Turf)

runners.breeder: A Chevalier Du Fau, Broadhurst Agency & Ecurie De Montlahuc
runners.comment: Useful sort who ran respectably in Listed event last time; more needed up in grade
runners.spotlight: Useful performer; won conditions event on AW over this trip in December (form didn't work out particularly well) and ran to a similar level in Listed event after three-month break last time; more needed up again in grade on first run away from testing ground.

runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: Progressive but goes up a fair way in grade on reappearance and may be suited by further
runners.spotlight: Promise on debut (7f, heavy) behind a subsequent winner in October and bettered that on AW debut the following month (Batal Dubai third and held); open to improvement but takes a big step up in grade and this trip on this ground may not be enough of a stamina test on reappearance.

runners.comment: Created good impression on debut (AW); up in grade but has the speed for this assignment
runners.spotlight: By Wootton Bassett out of a 7f Listed winner and created a favourable impression when successful over 7.5f on debut (AW) in November; well placed in a falsely run race but impressing with the way he went clear; up in grade but open to a good deal of improvement.

runners.owner: Al Shaqab Racing, Haras d'Etreham & Mustapha Bekhti

prev_owners.owner: Al Shaqab Racing, Haras d'Etreham & Mustapha Bekhti

runners.comment: Group 3 winner who was placed in the Lagardere on Arc day; big chance back up in trip
runners.spotlight: Irish 2,000 Guineas entry; stepped up markedly on narrow debut win when successful over this trip on soft in Group 3 in September; even better effort in the Group 1 Lagardere on Arc day; should be suited by the return to this trip on first outing since and, although yet to race away from soft on turf, has leading claims back in grade (no penalty).

runners.comment: Progressive sort last year but bit to find with Misunderstood on Lagardere form
runners.spotlight: Progressive sort who turned in easily his best effort last year when sixth in the Lagardere on final start; bit to find with the less-exposed Misunderstood on that evidence and he may again find one or two too strong.

runners.comment: Shaped as though retaining much of ability on reappearance; held by Darius Cen, though
runners.spotlight: Shaped as though retaining all his ability on reappearance when third to Darius Cen in Listed event on testing ground at Saint-Cloud; gets blinikers this time but work to do to reverse placings with that rival.

runners.comment: Listed winner on reappearance for new trainer; has to show he's as good on better ground
runners.spotlight: Wide-margin maiden winner last autumn who showed improved form to win Listed event on reappearance and first run for trainer at Saint-Cloud last month; he's a fine prospect but both wins came on testing ground so has to prove effectiveness on this sounder surface.

racecards.race_name: Prix de la Grotte (Group 3) (3yo Fillies) (Grande Course) (Turf)

runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: Only just beaten in Group 1 on final start as a 2yo; leading chance
runners.spotlight: Won first two starts and was a hot favourite for the C&D Group 1 Prix Marcel Boussac (1m, soft ground) after, but was beaten by a stablemate on the final stride; that was still a new personal best though so, with a pedigree like hers, she's readily given another chance; entered in the Pouliches (French 1000 Guineas) and the Diane (French Oaks).

runners.comment: Heavy ground may not have suited on last run; should have lots more to come
runners.spotlight: Won on debut at Haydock in early August (7f) under this rider but was then beaten at Goodwood, albeit on heavy ground; this is a new trip and there's every chance she has plenty more to come but she does need to step up on the figures; entered in the Pouliches and the Diane.

stable_tour.quote: She won nicely at Haydock and had working well at home so that wasn't a massive surprise. She could go to the Rockfel and there's also a £100,000 restricted final at Goodwood on September 25 that she's eligible for but I don't want to overrace her. 11-09-24

runners.breeder: Ecurie Haras Du Cadran, Ecurie Melanie & S Gilibert
runners.owner: Peter R Bradley III, F & O Hinderze Rcing, Ecurie Jml Racing

prev_owners.owner: F & O Hinderze Racing, Ecurie Jml Racing & NBB Racing

runners.comment: Looked really good on debut in February but held next time; more needed
runners.spotlight: Looked really good when winning by 6l on her debut in February over a mile but didn't progress from that when beaten as an odds-on shot in a conditions event the following month; still shapes as a very useful prospect though and this will be her first taste of racing on grass; entered in the Pouliches and the Diane.

runners.breeder: Haras D'Etreham, Glen Hill Farm & Riviera Equine Sarl
runners.owner: Ecurie David R Layani Family, Haras D'Etreham Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Riviera Equine Sarl, Haras D'Etreham & Craig Bernick

runners.comment: Unbeaten filly who has won at this track; warrants respect
runners.spotlight: Impressed when winning on debut here last year (1m1f, heavy ground) and maintained her unbeaten status when scoring on her 3yo return last month in a mile conditions event; plenty to like about the way she's progressing but this is a step up in class; entered in the Pouliches and the Diane.

runners.owner: Ecurie Francky Defosse, Frederic Sauque Et Al
runners.comment: Did have some good form last year but was last seen 7l behind Zarigana; can do better
runners.spotlight: Had some good form early in her juvenile campaign, notably beating subsequent Prix Marcel Boussac winner Vertical Blue on debut, but was 7l behind Zarigana in the Group 3 Prix d'Aumale in September, which clearly gives her something to find with that rival; entered in the Pouliches and the Diane.

runners.comment: Unbeaten in two AW races and is an interesting type for this switch to grass
runners.spotlight: Won on debut over a mile at Chantilly in December and backed that up in a conditions event (same track) on her return in February, going off odds on both times; looks capable of doing even better than she has to this point and an interesting contender; entered in the Pouliches.

runners.comment: Finished behind a couple of these in a Group 3 last year, so work to do here
runners.spotlight: Finished behind both Zarigana and Rosa Salvaje in the Group 3 Prix d'Aumale last year but did put in an improved effort on stable debut after than in a Listed event; not dismissed but others make more appeal.

racecards.race_name: Prix Noailles (Group 3) (3yo) (Grande Course) (Turf)

runners.owner: Charles Barel, Ecurie David R Layani Family & F Chappet
runners.comment: Was 5.5l behind Tito Mo Chen in an AW Listed event last time so more needed
runners.spotlight: Backed up his maiden success on final 2yo run with a win in a conditions event in February, but was 5.5l behind Tito Mo Chen in a 1m1f AW Listed event just over a month ago, so a bit to find returning to grass with that rival.

runners.comment: Progressing nicely but may struggle to confirm last tome form with Uther
runners.spotlight: Held on first three starts, but then won his next three, the most recent a head success over Uther in a 1m2f 110yds Listed event at Saint-Cloud; clearly been improving but may struggle to confirm form this time considering that rival is less exposed.

runners.owner: Laurent Dassault, Cormac Farrell Et Al
runners.comment: Looked good on his final 2yo run and is of interest under Christophe Soumillon
runners.spotlight: Held on debut but then went on to gain back-to-back 1m1f 110yds victories on the AW at Deauville, the last of which was impressive; shapes as though he'll stay this distance and one of the more interesting ones with Christophe Soumillon in the saddle this time.

runners.breeder: Haras De Montaigu & Mme Sybille Gibson
runners.comment: Sent off 10-1 when behind a couple of these last time; others easier to make cases for
runners.spotlight: Won first two, both AW events, but came up short when switched to turf in the race won by Aidan's Phone last month; others far easier to like for win purposes.

runners.comment: Looked good on debut and well bred; very much in the could be anything category
runners.spotlight: Notably a half-brother to Group 1 winner Junko (who won this in 2022); made a perfect start to his career when winning his maiden in September at Chantilly, finding plenty in front to produce quite a taking performance; very much in the could be anything category.

runners.comment: Only narrowly beaten by Aidan's Phone last time but has more to come
runners.spotlight: Related to plenty of smart performers, including last year's Grand Prix de Paris winner Sosie, and won on his sole start as a 2yo before being beaten only a head by Aidan's Phone in a Listed event on his 3yo return; likely player with further progress assured and same owner also has Nitoi.

runners.comment: Well bred colt who has won both starts so far on the AW; makes grass debut today
runners.spotlight: Unbeaten half-brother to Ramatuelle who won on debut in February before landing a Listed race last month over 1m1f, both those starts coming on the AW; no reason to think he can't translate that ability to grass, so has to be taken seriously.

racecards.race_name: Enter ITV7 For Free Handicap

runners.comment: May find this too sharp a test on return, from wide draw, if ground continues to dry out
runners.spotlight: Has won here twice over 1m1f; won final two starts last year at about this trip elsewhere; however, may find this too sharp a test on reappearance, from wide draw, if the ground continues to dry out.

stable_tour.quote: He joined us in the spring still a maiden after 25 runs, but he's really come alive since arriving here. I'd like to take all the credit but he's ridden by 74-year-old Jack Grey, who has done an amazing job. Jack has found the key to him and he has gone from strength to strength, winning five times and charging up the handicap from 47 to 69. Paul [Mulrennan] had ridden him before and told me he was much better than his form and he could be having a problem with his breathing, and a wind operation has clearly helped him. He's showing no signs of either regression or tiredness and, while he's in that form, I have every hope he can add another win very soon. 12-09-22

runners.comment: Formerly smart; hasn't won since 2022; struggled this year but tumbling down the weights
runners.spotlight: Formerly smart; hasn't won since 2022; struggled both starts this year but is tumbling down the weights.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Conditions Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Dawn Of Liberation ran so badly at Newmarket last time and nobody could really understand that. He emptied, but was quite free, so a mile might be better for him. He's still a baby and I think Churchill's progeny will just get better as they go on. We thought a lot of him before Newmarket - Paul Roy, owner.

stable_tour.quote: He'd sometimes been running to 102 and other times to 82, so we've tidied his wind up and I think he'll go to a handicap at Newmarket on Guineas day. He wouldn't want it soft. 02-05-23

There's a £20,000 race at Musselburgh on Sunday lined up for this well-bred sort. It's for those rated 41-68 and, as he's 68, it's the perfect opportunity. This time last year he was rated 85, so he has become well handicapped. 09-04-25

runners.comment: Easy to ignore on first start since being pulled up over hurdles in November
runners.spotlight: Saves his best for Carlisle and Hamilton; easy to ignore on first start since being pulled up over hurdles in November; usual headgear missing; back with former trainer.

runners.comment: Lost his way last year but may do better now dropping in class another five months on
runners.spotlight: Relatively lightly raced; fair maiden winner as a 2yo; lost his way last term but may do better now dropping in class another five months on.

runners.comment: Two wins last year including a similar race to this at Ripon; has been off for six months
runners.spotlight: Two wins last year (good to firm) including a similar race to this at Ripon, but needs to be on his game after six months off.

quotes.race: Market Cross Jewellers Handicap
quotes.quote: It was a good shout from Grant as I didn't think this would be Jesmond Dawn's trip. We thought a fair bit of him as a two-year-old and he disappointed a bit, so it's good to get his head in front - Sam James, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He was an expensive purchase but anything he does this season will be a bonus as he's bred to be more of a three-year-old. He finished third on his debut at Ripon, one place ahead of a horse who is now rated 80. On the day he was too keen and went too fast, but he'll have learned plenty from that. I hope to find a backend maiden before putting him away for next year. He looks a nice prospect. 30-08-23

runners.comment: Maiden; unappealing, dropping in trip from wide on first start since September
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced maiden; didn't progress over further last year; unappealing, dropping in trip from wide on first start since September.

runners.comment: Best form has come on AW and slow turf, so may need some rain to get in
runners.spotlight: Off since poor run in December, after which he had a breathing operation; best form has come on AW and slow turf, so may need some rain to get in, but latest win came following two-month break, so 'fresh' might be a good time to catch him.

runners.comment: Will have to do more than when fourth in a similar race over C&D when last seen
runners.spotlight: Will have to do more than when fourth in a similar race over C&D when last seen.

runners.comment: Best form has come on AW; has won on turf (good to firm) but not obviously well weighted
runners.spotlight: Best form has come on AW; has won on turf (good to firm) but not obviously well weighted.

runners.comment: There are a few negatives as to his chance, but he is a three-time course winner
runners.spotlight: Needs to come back to form, wide draw doesn't seem ideal and may not want the ground to dry out too much, but he is a three-time course winner.

runners.comment: Won 7f AW Class 5 handicap in December; faces a different test after four months off
runners.spotlight: Won 7f AW Class 5 handicap in December; faces a different test now; still has some potential, but he's been off for four months and is drawn wide.

runners.owner: David Scott and Co (Pattern Makers) Ltd
runners.comment: Ten-race maiden who has never tried this far and off since last August, but form claims
runners.spotlight: Ten-race maiden who has never tried this far and has been off since last August, but has some placed form that gives him a chance.

prev_owners.owner: M & M Racing, Paul Byrne And Partner

runners.comment: Handily weighted on his best and drawn to go the shortest route, but needs to bounce back
runners.spotlight: Versatile sort who is handily weighted on his best and drawn to go the shortest route, but needs to rebound from a poor run at Doncaster; cheekpieces refitted.

runners.comment: All five wins gained on AW at Wolverhampton, but also has form on fast turf; chance
runners.spotlight: All five wins gained on AW at Wolverhampton, the most recent over 9.4f in October, but also has form on fast turf; most recently too headstrong in cheekpieces, which are now removed; has a chance from a handy draw.

racecards.race_name: Sky Bet Club British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)

runners.comment: 62,000gns yearling; by first-season sire Supremacy; major stable; interesting newcomer
runners.spotlight: 62,000gns yearling; by first-season sire Supremacy and the first foal of an unraced sibling to Listed and Group 3 winners; major stable; interesting newcomer.

runners.comment: Out of a 6f 2yo Group 3 winner for his owner and represents last year's winning yard
runners.spotlight: Colt by Pinatubo out of a 6f 2yo winner (including Group 3; RPR 102) for his notable owner-breeder; represents last year's winning yard; strong credentials.

runners.comment: £140,000 yearling; Havana Grey half-brother to a Spanish 6f 2yo winner
runners.spotlight: £140,000 yearling; Havana Grey half-brother to Spanish 6f 2yo winner Viesgo, out of maiden half-sister to several useful winners; heed the market signals.

runners.comment: Showed speed in the Brocklesby at Doncaster before folding; may do better at this course
runners.spotlight: 12th of 17 when 33-1 in the Brocklesby at Doncaster (good to soft) but showed speed before folding and may do better in this sharper scenario with the outing under his belt.

runners.comment: £41,000 yearling; by Kodi Bear; stable has a modest strike-rate with 2yos
runners.spotlight: £41,000 yearling; by Kodi Bear and the first foal an unraced daughter of a 7f 2yo Group 2 winner; stable has a modest strike-rate with 2yos; others preferred.

runners.comment: £30,000 yearling; by first-season sire A'Ali and first foal of a Swedish 7f winner
runners.spotlight: 18,000euros foal, £30,000 yearling; by first-season sire A'Ali and the first foal of a Swedish 7f winner; trainer's only 2yo runner thus far this term shaped well.

runners.comment: 100,000euros yearling; by first-season sire Starman out of sister to a 5f 2yo G2 winner
runners.spotlight: 100,000euros yearling; by first-season sire Starman out of unraced sister to 5f 2yo Group 2 winner Ardad; possibilities, especially if the market speaks positively.

racecards.race_name: Sky Bet Acca Freeze Handicap

runners.comment: Off same mark as Ayr Class 4 win (5f, good to firm) last June; encouragement latest
runners.spotlight: Off same mark as when winning Ayr Class 4 (5f, good to firm) last June; encouragement latest; contender.

runners.comment: Hasn't won since 2021 but went close in C&D Class 2 on last season's reappearance
runners.spotlight: Hasn't won since 2021 and absent since October; however, went close in C&D Class 2 on last season's reappearance; tongue-tie fitted for the first time in a while.

quotes.race: WSG Sports Signage Handicap
quotes.quote: Arecibo loved the ground and he was down in class so he was entitled to win like that - Frankie Dettori, jockey.

runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.comment: Last two wins gained over C&D, the most recent in September (good ground); contender
runners.spotlight: Last two wins gained over C&D, the most recent in September (good ground); shaped well on last month's reappearance at Newcastle (denied clear run; just behind Alligator Alley); contender.

quotes.race: Watch On Racing TV Handicap
quotes.quote: It worked out well. I haven't a clue why Zarzyni won there, we've tried everything with him. He's very smart, but I don't think the horse knows he's won. If he had time to think he'd have got beaten. He's a handy type to have in the yard as he's a very good work horse. When we have sprinters we have to work, he's the boy. We're thankful he's won and Musselburgh's been a lucky place for us -  oint-trainer David Barron, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Zarzyni is very straightforward and had been working well. For one of ours to win first time is always a good sign. We thought he was up to winning a maiden but not necessarily first time - Michael Halford, trainer.

runners.owner: R J H Limited And Ruth Carr
runners.comment: Encouraging debut for this stable on reappearance; fair chance he'll build on that
runners.spotlight: Was a smart sprint handicapper for David O'Meara on his day; encouraging debut for this stable at Newcastle on reappearance; fair chance he'll build on that from a handy mark.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: It was very easy. I think five furlongs is going to be the key to him, I don't think he stays six really. We've bounced and done things right. I'm not sure if it was much of a maiden but he gave me a nice feel today. He was behind some proper horses in maidens. Even though he wasn't getting near to them it was proper, nearly top-class, form in the book - Donnacha O'Brien, rider

stable_tour.quote: Won a couple of times last year including at the Racing League. He wants five furlongs in fast conditions and there's a nice race for him at York in May before the Epsom Dash in June. He's capable of popping up in those types of races. 19-04-24

He had a long career with David O'Meara before coming here and I'm pleased to have him because he's a lovely looking sort. He had his first race for us at Newcastle last month, running without any headgear and coming fourth of eight. Headgear will be an option next time he runs. 09-04-25

runners.comment: Has a win and a nose second from his two starts over C&D; could bounce back to form
runners.spotlight: Has a win and a nose second from his two starts over C&D; completed a hat-trick on the AW early this year; raced too freely when failing to beat a rival latest, but could bounce back.

quotes.race: Gamble Responsibly At BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: Castan has always had loads of speed, but as a two-year-old he was the biggest hooligan I've had in my life! He just took a long time to get mentally right after a break. As soon as you touch the blindfold he comes out of the stalls like a greyhound. They all came at him and he fought back. Hopefully he can give us a big payout someday - Bryan Smart, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Start Racing TV Free Trial Now Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Castan did it nicely and Kevin never hit him. He said all day long that Castan would win these types of races and I'm delighted for the owners - Bryan Smart, trainer.

runners.owner: HP Racing Stash The Cash & PTR
runners.comment: Three wins last year, including on reappearance, but they came on slow going
runners.spotlight: Three wins up to Class 5 last year, including on reappearance, but they came on slow going so he may not want the ground to dry out; off since November.

stable_tour.quote: He had a few little issues and was very hard to train last year, and he got himself handicapped because of that. But we've been really pleased with him this year and he won well at Catterick first time. 23-04-24

runners.comment: Hold-up horse who needs things to drop right and has a good jockey for that in D Tudhope
runners.spotlight: Hold-up horse who needs things to drop right and has a good jockey for that in Daniel Tudhope; got no sort of run at Newcastle latest; ten-time winner; chance.

stable_tour.quote: He won twice for us as a juvenile and then left for a season before joining us in July after a Carlisle win for Rebecca Menzies. He's in the form of his life and has won twice more for us, rising from 61 to 76 in the handicap. He's far from straightforward but we know his quirks. He must walk to the start and goes in the stalls without a jockey. He was carried badly left and promoted to third in the stewards' room at Windsor last Thursday. He stayed down in the area and ran another good race on Saturday when fourth at Ascot, which more than paid for his trip. He thrives on his racing and could be a Bronze Cup hope at Ayr next week. 12-09-22

runners.comment: Raced too freely from wide draw when well beaten at Wolverhampton latest; earlier in form
runners.spotlight: Headstrong; raced too freely from wide draw when well beaten at Wolverhampton latest; was earlier in form; may bounce back.

quotes.race: William Hill Play Responsibly/EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That wasn't ideal. We wanted to take a lead but Catch Cunningham jumped well and no-one wanted to go on. We reverted to plan B and that's hard to do here. But he's very game and genuine. He'll be better in a better race -  Kevin Ryan, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's fast and extremely genuine. He ran well first time out and will go for the five-furlong handicap at York, though he'll get six. 10-05-22

runners.comment: Five wins in lower classes, including C&D last summer; can build on reappearance run
runners.spotlight: Five wins in lower classes, including C&D last summer; no impression here on reappearance but that was a Class 3 and she should be better for the run; another with claims.

stable_tour.quote: She's had a really good season, winning five times. It was frustrating to get beat last time when she got hampered in the Ayr Bronze Cup. She's a homebred and we purposely let her mature. I still think there's improvement in her but we've decided that was enough for the season. Hopefully she'll come back off a nice mark next year and we'll look to follow in the footsteps of American Affair. 02-10-24

runners.comment: Sole win came over C&D as a 2yo; has had a breathing operation since last seen
runners.spotlight: Sole win came over C&D as a 2yo; has had a breathing operation since last seen in November; competitively weighted.

quotes.race: British EBF 40th Anniversary Fillies' Conditions Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ziggy's Queen is learning with racing. There wasn't really much pace in the race so I thought it would be ideal if I could jump and get an easy lead. She only had to really run (sprint) for two furlongs, so she'll probably come on for that again - Oisin Orr, jockey speaking to Racing TV.

prev_owners.owner: Capla Development, J Nordoff, L Westwood

runners.comment: Form contender, although may not want the ground to dry out much
runners.spotlight: Won Class 3 Chester handicap last May (good ground); not beaten far when midfield in competitive Doncaster handicap on reappearance and would have finished even closer with a clear run; form contender, although may not want the ground to dry out much.

quotes.race: tote.co.uk Saddle-Up For More Than Racing Handicap
quotes.quote: We didn't give Joanna any instructions, we just wanted to see what the drop back was going to do and it seems to have worked. It's Epsom next next, that's the plan - the three-year-old only Dash, because it's easier to win! - David Easterby, joint-trainer of Knicks.

runners.comment: Won two Class 5 handicaps last term; pleasing return; still, needs to run as well as ever
runners.spotlight: Won two Class 5 handicaps last term (5f, good to firm/good to soft); needs to run as well as ever but should be better for her reasonably encouraging reappearance at Doncaster.

runners.comment: Not straightforward but he was third in this race on last season's reappearance
runners.spotlight: Not straightforward and finished unplaced in C&D Class 5 when last seen in October; however, third in this race on last season's reappearance.

stable_tour.quote: He's a bairn I know well as I trained his dam and granny, but he hasn't been easy to train. First time out this year he dropped Paul Mulrennan going to the start but, despite his quirks, he has an engine. I have an idea to run him on the all-weather to change the script a little. He's in grand form at home and we'll look at the 5f and 7f handicaps next week at Ayr. 12-09-22

prev_owners.owner: Mrs H Mannion, B Carter & F Durbin

runners.comment: Irish-trained runner whose last three wins have come over C&D, latest 2023
runners.spotlight: Irish-trained runner whose last three wins have come over C&D, latest 2023; encouraging third in Bellewstown handicap latest; in the mix.

quotes.race: Bellinter Handicap
quotes.quote: Only Spoofing loves this track and trip. He cut out at Naas last day and back to five today suited him - Kevin Coleman, trainer.

quotes.race: Neptune Investment Management Supports Child Bereavement UK Handicap
quotes.quote: Only Spoofing is improving and came here in good form. He was great today and I think he could win a big one before the end of the year - Kieran O'Neill, jockey.

quotes.race: Troytown Bar Handicap
quotes.quote: He can be very buzzy and went to the start early. Sean (Davis) had ridden him before and gave him a very brave ride. He's great value for his 7lb claim and you'd never think he was a claimer watching that ride. I'd imagine Only Spoofing will be coming back to Ireland before the end of the season - Tim Hogg, assistant to Jedd O'Keeffe, trainer of Only Spoofing.

runners.owner: Hard Held Partnership And Angus Racing

prev_owners.owner: Angus Racing Club & P D Niven

runners.comment: Has won over C&D but all five of his victories have come in Class 6 handicaps
runners.spotlight: Has won over C&D but all five of his victories have come in Class 6 handicaps; off seven weeks.

runners.comment: Eight wins but the last seven have come at Class 6 level; bit more needed than of late
runners.spotlight: Eight wins but the last seven have come at Class 6 level; bit more needed than of late.

quotes.race: Bresbet Rewards Loyalty Handicap
quotes.quote: Golden Rainbow has been brilliant for us. We picked this race out when he won here before and both that and his last run at Musselburgh have worked out. He's the only horse to beat Phil McEntee's Jacquelina on turf this year, who's now rated in the 80s and well thought of. He loves the fast ground and I hope he can continue to progress to pick up a couple more prizes in the Yorkshire area - Rebecca Menzies, trainer.

racecards.race_name: Sky Bet Extra Places Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.comment: Record of 3-8 switched to handicaps last term; could improve further this year
runners.spotlight: Record of 3-8 switched to handicaps last term; ran creditably behind Tafsir in a Scottish event on final start when bidding for a hat-trick; looks the type who could improve further this year; shortlisted.

runners.owner: J S Morrison & Ms Carol Morrison
runners.comment: Bagged a £100,000 bonus for winning three Sky Bet Sunday Series events last year
runners.spotlight: Absent since prevailing narrowly at Pontefract eight months ago when becoming the first horse to land the £100,000 bonus for winning three Sky Bet Sunday Series races (gained those wins over 1m3f, 1m6f and 2m1f); not crying out for this big drop back in distance but otherwise has strong claims, being a progressive sort who is 3-6 since handicapping.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Build A Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: Letsbefrank is getting very lethargic in his races and he was never on the bridle. He's tough and game, but the Johnston horse got a soft lead and you know they'll always keep going. But this horse keeps digging, he's tough. I'm lucky I'm the one pointing him, but this has been the plan for Jim and his team since the winter. He's had all the races mapped out, credit to him. To win one race is hard but to win three takes some doing - Paul Mulrennan, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: We targeted the Sunday series and he just managed to win the £100k bonus with a short-head success at Pontefract in August. He's a wee bit sore now after a couple of runs on fast ground. It's nothing major but that'll be it for the year. He was in the Cesarewitch but I've scratched him from that. Hopefully he'll progress again next year into some top races. 02-10-24

runners.comment: Has form figures of 1121 in last four attempts at Musselburgh; possibilities
runners.spotlight: Record of 8-29 on turf, all wins in Scotland, including five last season; has form figures of 1121 in last four attempts at Musselburgh; possibilities, even though she remains on career-high mark.

quotes.race: Racecourse Live Streams On Racing TV Extra Handicap
quotes.quote: Tafsir is a well-bred filly so it's good to get a win, but Paul's given her an absolute peach of a ride. He's gone down the brave man's route down the inside rail and has won quite comfortably in the end. She'll win again, especially with the assistance of Paul. He's top-class - Jim Goldie, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's had a great season, winning five races, and is still improving. Her last win at Hamilton was probably her most impressive. It was a well-timed run from Paul Mulrennan and she did it well. She could get another couple of wins this year if she gets the right conditions and, regarding trip, she's versatile. She ran over 1m2f two starts ago at Ayr and Paul said that if it had been softer ground, she'd have been a player. So when she dropped in class a wee bit and got softer ground at Hamilton over 1m4f, she won well. She'll keep going now. The idea is to send her to stud later on, but she might progress to be a top horse. She could start appearing in some of the big staying handicaps next season. 02-10-24

runners.comment: Regressed last year after reappearance win but this may be the time to catch him
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo who is making seasonal debut; regressed in handicaps last year after winning a maiden on reappearance but this may be the time to catch him; had wind surgery over the winter.

runners.comment: Opened his account in AW event on debut for new yard; could well build on that win
runners.spotlight: Maiden in Ireland; edged ahead close home at Southwell (1m3f, AW) last month on debut for new connections; could well build on that win and show further progress in Britain; again ridden by Hector Crouch, who has a very good strike-rate for James Owen; sole runner on the card for this trainer, who is 2-2 with Musselburgh runners; strongly respected up just 2lb.

runners.comment: Most wins in lower grades; opposed off current mark in this competitive field
runners.spotlight: Returns to a more suitable trip with 1m2f reappearance under his belt; however, he has done most of his winning in lower grades and can be opposed off current mark in this competitive Class 4 event.

quotes.race: National Racehorse Week Amateur Jockeys' Handicap
quotes.quote: He's fantastic, he loves it round here. This is his level; perfect. The Dancing Poet is nine years old now but he seems to be getting better with age - Matt Brown, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: weatherbysshop.co.uk Handicap
quotes.quote: The Dancing Poet is a big galloping horse but he likes sharp tracks. He's one-paced but he felt unreal today. He quickened up really well off a steady pace. I was always in the driving seat to kick on and he won nicely in the end - Ben Robinson, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.comment: Close second in this contest last year but has lacked consistency since
runners.spotlight: Gained last success over hurdles and has become inconsistent on the Flat; close second in this contest last year but isn't certain to repeat that effort; registered both C&D wins (in 2023) in lower grades.

quotes.race: AEJ Facilities Management Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We were very disappointed last week at Carlisle so Doreen [Monteith, owner] said let's try Simple Star back over hurdles. He was a little star for us last year on the Flat. He came back this season and ran a great race at Musselburgh and then I think it was trainer error putting him into tracks that started with a downhill and he just got too keen. Hopefully, he'll be back at Musselburgh at the end of the Flat season - Dianne Sayer, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.comment: Campaigned mostly in lower grades; back on career-high mark; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Campaigned mostly in lower grades; absent since finishing second over C&D five months ago; behind two of these rivals in Class 4 the time before; back on career-high mark and not the percentage call.

runners.comment: In good form on AW; nearly completed a hat-trick last time; rarely seen on turf
runners.spotlight: Hurdles winner who has done the majority of his Flat racing on AW; ran well at Wolverhampton most recently, nearly completing a hat-trick; bit to prove back on turf but can't be dismissed in current form.

stable_tour.quote: Jonathan: He ran a strong race when he finished second on the Flat at Newcastle last time and showed he stays 1m4½f. He'll probably return to hurdles at Huntingdon on Thursday. He disappointed on his last hurdles run but he made a bad mistake and may have just jarred himself a bit. Sam: He pulled a shoe off and we struggle with his feet, they're big and take a bit of minding. He's another who does a lot of swimming. 08-02-24

runners.comment: Three-time AW winner; 0-12 on turf and has stamina to prove over this trip
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner at 1m-1m2f on AW, most recently in January (inconsistent since); has the ability to get involved but brings negatives, as he's 0-12 on turf and has stamina to prove over this new trip.

runners.comment: Record of 0-6 (Flat/hurdles) for new stable; held in lower grade here last time
runners.spotlight: Couple of Class 6 wins at Beverley last May for previous yard; record of 0-6 (Flat/hurdles) for new stable, only fourth of five in Class 5 here most recently; difficult assignment upped further in grade.

stable_tour.quote: He's the first horse we've had for Jimmy Fyffe and was rated 71 on the Flat when trained by Ollie Sangster, winning at 1m2f and 1m4f. He's schooled very well and will start in a juvenile hurdle at Musselburgh at the end of November, with a view to looking at some of the lucrative juvenile hurdles if we can. 16-10-24

runners.comment: Low-mileage 6yo who may progress now handicapping
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 6yo who is one of four runners for Jim Goldie; runner-up over hurdles in Ireland; has a jumps pedigree but his AW efforts for new yard have not been devoid of promise; may progress now handicapping.

runners.comment: Veteran who has done most of his winning at Ayr; 4lb out of weights
runners.spotlight: Veteran who scored at Musselburgh in 2021 but has done the rest of his winning at Ayr; finished third in small-field Class 5 here on seasonal debut; stiffer task from 4lb out of weights in this race.

quotes.race: CPMS Handicap
quotes.quote: I've won on Glasses Up a few times. We thought the mile might be short for him but he's proved us wrong. They went a good gallop and he picked up well - Paddy Mathers, jockey.

quotes.race: Get So Much More With Racing UK Handicap
quotes.quote: Glasses Up is just getting better and better and in time I'm sure he will step up to one and a half miles. His target is the Kilkerran Cup at the Gold Cup meeting - Mike Smith, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's been a super horse. When I bought him at the sales I was told I could spend £8k, maybe £10k at a push, and I rang the boys up and said, “I'm going to have to go to full budget for this.” The boys said, “Mike, that's a lot of money for a horse who hasn't run”, and I said “yes, but he's a cracking horse.” He was actually bought with an entry for the Derby. He's now won eight races for us and £121k in prize-money, so it was money well spent. The boys have turned down fairly good offers for him because they wanted to keep racing and having fun with him, which is commendable. He was a good third on his seasonal reappearance at Ayr behind Fiver Friday. He benefited from a racecourse gallop on the track after the Scottish National meeting, which is a fantastic thing and I think that's one of the reasons the Irish horses do so well. 16-05-24

racecards.race_name: Sky Bet Build A Bet Handicap

runners.comment: Close 2nd on debut and he's since landed odds of 8-13 and 1-7; makes handicap/turf debut
runners.spotlight: 2,000 Guineas entry; close second on debut in November and he's since landed odds of 8-13 at Lingfield (1m) in December and 1-7 at Wolverhampton (9.4f) in March; there was an element of hanging on for both those wins but he had looked in charge (made the running last time) and is surely better than the bare results; stall 1 at this track should ensure a bold show on handicap/turf debut.

quotes.race: Free Bets With BetUK Bet Club Restricted Novice Stakes (For horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Marhaba Ghaiyyath was still quite raw. We went round on the wrong lead for a lot of the race and had to do it the hard way in front. I think you'd have seen a better horse if he'd had something to aim at, but he got the job done. He's actually quite weak and I think he could come back to a mile and he could step back up in trip as he gets a bit stronger - Billy Loughnane, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM/EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands C/D) (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: Marhaba Ghaiyyath was a bit unlucky not to collect on his debut at Wolverhampton so it was nice that he got his head in front. Charlie [Johnston, trainer] thinks he's a nice type and it could well be that he runs again on the all-weather - Bruce Raymond, owner's racing manager.

runners.comment: Made the frame twice before running on well for a Redcar novice win (7f, soft) in November
runners.spotlight: Made the frame at Ayr (good) and York (1m, soft; bred to stay but raced too freely) before running on well for his novice win at Redcar (7f, soft) in November; gelded since; handicap/seasonal debut and open to more progress.

runners.comment: Easily best 2yo effort when making most on final start; goes handicapping with potential
runners.spotlight: 7-2, 14-1 and 125-1 for his three starts last July-September and he finished fifth in all of them, easily best effort when making most in a maiden at Doncaster (1m, good) on final occasion; gelded since; goes handicapping and his best should still be ahead of him.

runners.breeder: White Birch SC & Lynch Bages Ltd
runners.comment: Similar form throughout his five-race 2yo career; left Eve Johnson Houghton for 41,000gns
runners.spotlight: Similar form throughout his five-race 2yo career, on the premises every time except at Royal Ascot; tried cheekpieces on final start and ran in 1m nurseries on last two, so he's comparatively exposed; left Eve Johnson Houghton for 41,000gns in September and has been gelded.

runners.owner: James Paul Services To Industry Ltd
runners.comment: 3-9 as 2yo with three wins on AW; return six weeks ago might have blown away a few cobwebs
runners.spotlight: 3-9 as 2yo with three wins over 7f on AW (similar form in one of his runs on soft); gelded before last of six on AW return six weeks ago, which might have blown away a few cobwebs but others should bring more potential.

runners.comment: Ran in four maidens for Donnacha O'Brien last May-November, placed twice on testing ground
runners.spotlight: Four maiden races for Donnacha O'Brien last May-November, placed twice on testing ground and two lesser shows on AW; wore cheekpieces last two outings; marked improvement is needed on this handicap, seasonal and stable debut.

runners.comment: Best efforts over about 1m at York and Beverley (good; made most) on last two 2yo starts
runners.spotlight: Had four races last season, best efforts over about 1m at York (good to soft) and Beverley (good; made most) on last two occasions; gelded since; needs better on this handicap/seasonal debut.

runners.comment: 2nd of 9 in nursery at Leopardstown (1m, soft) in October; left Jim Bolger for 60,000gns
runners.spotlight: Three of his five races last season had taken place by early June but his best effort came when second of nine in a nursery at Leopardstown (1m, soft) in October; left Jim Bolger for 60,000gns later that month and gelded since; each-way player judged on that latest effort and stable going well.

racecards.race_name: Sky Bet Proud To Support ROR Handicap

runners.owner: Paul Corrigan & Miss L A Perratt
runners.comment: AW form dipped the last twice; refused to race when last seen on turf; comes with risk
runners.spotlight: AW form dipped the last twice; has done his winning on turf but losing spell goes back to 2023 and he refused to race when last seen in this sphere; comes with risk.

runners.breeder: Skymarch Farm Inc & Ecurie Des Charmes
runners.comment: Hasn't won since 2023 but remains well treated on peak form; 9lb below last winning mark
runners.spotlight: Recent form figures include three placed efforts; below par last time and hasn't won since 2023 but remains well treated on peak form; he is 9lb below last winning mark.

stable_tour.quote: He joined us earlier this month from Charlie Wallis and his first run at Musselburgh was very encouraging when third of 11 over 7f. He ran even better than that last week at Doncaster when beaten only one and a half lengths. For a horse who needs the race to be run at an end-to-end gallop he did not enjoy proceedings on Town Moor as they crawled most of the way before it developed into a sprint, so all things considered it was a fine effort. Both of his runs for me have been over 7f but I am trying him over a mile at Carlisle on Wednesday. His current mark of 73 is very fair and I would be very hopeful of him winning before long. 22-06-22

runners.comment: Very solid success at Catterick when last seen; that race has worked out well; respected
runners.spotlight: Very solid success at Catterick (7f) when last seen six months ago, taking record to 5-22 and producing a career-best performance; that race has worked out well; respected.

quotes.race: Spreadex Racing In-Running Spread Betting Handicap
quotes.quote: There is quite a stiff side and head wind now, but he still picked up lovely. I know he's also won at Redcar and Catterick, but he probably has more strengthening to do and confidence to gain - Faye McManoman, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.comment: Record of 2-4 since wearing cheekpieces; possibilities in the retained headgear
runners.spotlight: Record of 2-4 since wearing cheekpieces, both wins at Ayr (7f/6f); maiden previously; may have more to offer in the retained headgear; possibilities on seasonal debut.

stable_tour.quote: He's a maiden but has run some massive races. Reflecting on his last couple of races, I think he wants to come back to 7f. He gets a mile but he's got a bit of speed and his best form has been at 7f. He could be progressive on goodish ground. 26-07-24

runners.breeder: J P M Main &  Andrew Knott
runners.comment: Raced mainly at sprint trips since August 2023; not crying out for return to 7f
runners.spotlight: Has won over 7f but the majority of his form since August 2023 is at sprint distances (5.7f scorer last term); not crying out for the return to this trip.

quotes.race: Ascot Shop Handicap
quotes.quote: Mister Bluebird's dam won this race seven years ago and he is her only foal, so it's a good story. We wanted to see if he'd get this trip and Rossa [Ryan, jockey] felt this stiff six was just what he wanted. He was having a good look at the stand too. We'll wait for the handicapper and then see what we do next - Heather Main, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 Handicap
quotes.quote: Mister Bluebird was very straightforward last year and unlucky not to win. He got the job done today and I'm pleased for the horse. - William Buick, rider

runners.comment: Disappointing in last appearance but progressive otherwise; may still have more to offer
runners.spotlight: Progressive over 6f until disappointing in last appearance; retains low mileage and may still have more to offer; gives the impression he'll stay this new trip; on the shortlist.

runners.comment: Attractively treated on best AW form but failed to reproduce it on turf last time
runners.spotlight: Attractively handicapped on best AW form but failed to reproduce it last time in a rare turf attempt, albeit not entirely disgraced; brings rather mixed messages.

stable_tour.quote: He's won his last two. He'll be entered on December 12 at Newcastle in a 0-78 and also on December 14 at Southwell n a 0-78 over a mile. I don't think he's stopped winning as he's been successful with a bit more up his sleeve. He's definitely one to follow for the all-weather. 05-12-24

runners.comment: Most recent attempt at Musselburgh resulted in her fourth course win; one to consider
runners.spotlight: Fairly useful filly whose most recent attempt at Musselburgh resulted in her fourth course win; still favourably treated on historical data and looks interesting back here.

runners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd
runners.comment: 0-6 on turf but ran well off this mark on last attempt in this sphere; now blinkered
runners.spotlight: Three-time AW winner; 0-6 on turf but ran well off this mark on last attempt in this sphere; placed possibilities provided he takes well to first-time blinkers.

runners.comment: Went close at Doncaster two weeks ago on second run for new yard; fighting chance
runners.spotlight: Four wins, mostly off this mark, for previous yard; went close in competitive field over 7f at Doncaster two weeks ago on second run for new stable; fighting chance.

quotes.race: Plan A Consulting Handicap (Chepstow Mile Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: We were going to sell Stockpyle at the July sales, but PJ [McDonald, jockey] said something was troubling him. We took him to the vets and checked him, where we found a huge growth under his epiglottis. It was like having a cork in a bottle and he couldn't breathe, but now his confidence is being rewarded. He's been running some lovely races and has been unlucky not to win more. He's from a very good family and there's more excitement to come - William Muir, joint-trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Another of La Pyle's progeny who is a half-brother to Pyledriver, he did his owners proud this summer by winning twice in four days at Chepstow and Wolverhampton, both over 7f. I love him and having had a tiny injury as a juvenile - a split pastern that healed beautifully - he has made steady progress. He was last of six at Chepstow on Monday but must have the ground just right and when things go his way he looks pretty impressive. Clearly 7f is his trip and there are more wins to come this year. 01-09-22

runners.breeder: Miss Nell Kent & Miss Sophie Bates
runners.comment: Returns to 7f on this second start for new stable; 0-16 at trips beyond a bare 6f
runners.spotlight: Ran encouragingly in AW contest on stable/seasonal debut and has a competitive chance off the same mark on this return to 7f; however, he's 0-16 at trips beyond a bare 6f.

quotes.race: bet365 EBF Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: Hectic is very straightforward, he trains himself. We've made a lot of entries for him and when we've gone to declare we haven't. He was there to be shot at in front and there's a lot of improvement to come. Dobby loved him and said the ground didn't feel that quick on him; I'd say the ground's lovely. You might look at something like the Acomb, and he's very nice. He's a heavy-set, strong lad, so we'll have to be careful and I'd say he'd get seven furlongs no problem. That was probably quite a smart race - Richard Hannon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We struggled to get him back last year after he failed mentally to handle his second outing at York. He ran a super race in a Newbury handicap over seven furlongs on soft ground on his reappearance, though, and I think he'll be a lot better on a sounder surface and with that run under his belt. I was disappointed he went up 6lb, but I think he'll still be very competitive in good handicaps on his way to the Britannia. 02-05-23

Some of the horses just aren't getting their heads in front and this guy is one. He's taken a couple of runs to get fit this year but he's got them under his belt now. He ran a massive race to finish fourth at York last month under Hollie Doyle and we were pleased with that. Unfortunately at Doncaster on his next start, Kieran O'Neill dropped his reins in the last 100 yards and we were just beaten in a photo-finish by Silver Samurai. He might go to Pontefract on Sunday and he'll be a solid handicapper who'll go to the likes of York and be competitive - he was a good fifth there last weekend. 21-06-24

runners.comment: Losing spell goes back to 2022; however, he has dropped to an attractive mark
runners.spotlight: Losing spell goes back to 2022; however, he's dropped to an attractive mark and could go well with AW reappearance under his belt, provided wide draw proves no issue.

racecards.race_name: Sky Bet For The Fans Handicap

runners.comment: Good second in two major handicaps during his 2024 campaign; respected in this field
runners.spotlight: No win since 2023; however, a good second in major handicaps at Ascot (7f) and Ripon (6f) during his 2024 campaign, showing career-best form; on a workable mark and warrants respect in this field.

quotes.race: William Hill Great St Wilfrid Handicap
quotes.quote: I was cheering for them both because they both deserved it. Ramazan really deserves one as he just got beat at Ascot earlier in the season. Ramazan must be a tough horse, over six or seven furlongs he always runs his heart out and he's probably Listed class - Robin O'Ryan, trainer's assistant.

quotes.race: Price Promise At bet365 Handicap
quotes.quote: I thought Ramazan didn't stay the mile at Ascot, but he ran a big race there. That was seven today and he might go six in time as he's from a fast family. A bit of rain would help him and he's a good hardy horse - Richard Fahey, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: It was a great run. When Ramazan ran at Ascot he had a set of blinkers and I think he just did a shade too much but without those today off that kind of mark he's done it well. His work at home is very good so I can't see why he won't progress from that - Oisin Orr, rider.

runners.comment: Record of 4-10 last term for new yard; possibilities if taking well to first-time hood
runners.spotlight: Record of 4-10 last season for new yard featured wins at Musselburgh (7f) and Ascot (Shergar Cup Mile); another productive campaign may be on the way; possibilities if taking well to first-time hood.

stable_tour.quote: He's new to me. He had a little hold-up and didn't run last year, but he won a maiden at Southwell last month over five furlongs and then ran over six at Wolverhampton. It looked like it was plenty sharp enough for him so we'll move him up to seven. There are some nice races for him coming up, including at York in May. 19-04-24

runners.comment: Defied this mark here two years ago but needs to prove he retains that ability
runners.spotlight: Has looked a shadow of his former self in his three runs since 2023; defied this mark two years ago in his last Musselburgh start (fifth course win) but needs to prove he's still capable of that form.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Ayr Gold Cup Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: It's fantastic, Gweedore jumped and travelled well, everything went great, I think he was just beaten by two better handicapped horses at the end of the day. It's just fantastic to have a horse here in the Gold Cup. He's been an amazing horse for his owners, they're Scottish too, so to even have a runner in the race is very special. The options are a bit dry on the ground over seven furlongs for him, so we'll probably look at something again over six - Katie Scott, trainer.

quotes.race: Aspall Premier Cru Handicap
quotes.quote: Gweedore hit the rising ground which really suited him and the further he went the better - Katie Scott, trainer.

quotes.race: tote.co.uk Bet£5Get£20 Musselburgh Silver Arrow Handicap
quotes.quote: I didn't think Gweedore would get such an easy lead but he was going quite well and I just let him bowl away. He's done it well in the end - Billy Loughnane, jockey, speaking on ITV

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: We thought Gweedore was really well but he had a tricky draw. Jason (Hart) gave him a great ride, he got him in the perfect position and it all went to plan - Katie Scott, trainer.

runners.comment: 5-14 for this yard; met traffic issues on reappearance; should improve on that form
runners.spotlight: Record of 5-14 for current stable includes three wins last year; had wind surgery prior to having little luck (met traffic issues) in the Spring Mile on reappearance; should improve on that bare form.

stable_tour.quote: The plan is to start him off in a mile handicap at Naas on Monday. He's doing things nicely at home. A mile or even 1m2f will suit him well. 21-04-23

runners.comment: Swallowed up over 1m last time; progressive over 7f; has a 9lb higher mark on AW
runners.spotlight: Swallowed up in the Spring Mile last time; progressive over 7f and currently has a 9lb higher mark on AW, having scored in emphatic style at Southwell two starts ago; great chance provided that form is repeated.

quotes.race: Bet Boost At bet365 Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Our Havana had been working well at home so that was no surprise but he was very idle in front. When the runner up came to him he went again - Oisin Orr, rider.

runners.comment: Trained in Ireland since December; interesting on the pick of his British form
runners.spotlight: Trained in Ireland since December, racing mostly on AW (ran respectably last time); three-time turf winner, notably off 3lb higher, in Britain previously; interesting assuming he's still capable of that form.

quotes.race: Sky Bet In Running Racing Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Catch The Paddy has got a great attitude, he's so laid back. He's got a big frame and he's still got a long way to go, he'll be a nice horse next year - Adam Ryan, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: As long as it's not very soft, we'll start him off over 7f at the Craven meeting, but he gets a mile no issue. He's wintered well and we feel we may have underachieved a little bit with him last season, so hopefully he's in for a good campaign. We still haven't got to the bottom of him and he's entitled to be competitive in those good handicaps at the festivals. 04-04-24

runners.comment: Ended last season with a Scottish hat-trick; may be capable of further progress
runners.spotlight: Ended last season with a Scottish hat-trick that comprised 1m wins at Musselburgh (twice) and Ayr; gives the impression he'll prove as effective back over 7f; one to consider, with further progress plausible.

runners.comment: Record of 6-8 since wearing a hood but all of that form is over 5f/6f on AW
runners.spotlight: Record of 6-8 since wearing a hood but all of that form is in much lower grades over sprint distances on AW; certainly progressive but has something to prove upped in trip/class and back on turf.

stable_tour.quote: He's a homebred and we're hoping maybe he'll do what Eternal Sunshine has done. He's matured a lot and I've given him time. He's had four runs and we'll probably give him a few runs on the all-weather, but I don't think we'll have a hard campaign with him. We'll see how he progresses but he should be a nice horse to follow next year. I hate to saddle him with it but he'd be my dark horse. 02-10-24

racecards.race_name: Total Catering Solutions Celebrating 20 Years Mares' Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: No form in her four races over hurdles and she has since had a wind operation
runners.spotlight: Exposed maiden, mostly in Irish bumpers; no form in her four races over hurdles and she has since had a wind operation.

runners.comment: Second in 2m6f novice for mares at Uttoxeter (soft) in December but well beaten since
runners.spotlight: Second in 2m6f novice for mares at Uttoxeter (soft) in December but well beaten since, in handicaps on last two starts; cheekpieces joined the tongue-tie last time; best form sets the standard but there have to be doubts.

stable_tour.quote: She's a three-parts sister to El Fabiolo and will appear in a bumper shortly. 13-11-23

runners.breeder: Sir J Timpson & H D J Daly
runners.comment: 2nd of seven finishers at Doncaster (2m, good) in a mares' maiden hurdle one month ago
runners.spotlight: Fourth in the first of her two bumpers; behind when she fell at the last on jumps debut but confirmed she has some ability when second of seven finishers at Doncaster (2m, good) in another mares' maiden hurdle one month ago; player in this weak race.

runners.owner: Tim Cottier And Razor Ruddock Racing 1

prev_owners.owner: Tim Cottier And Razor Ruddock Racing 1

runners.comment: Fairly useful on Flat; let down by jumping at Doncaster (2m, good) behind Keep On Cobbling
runners.spotlight: Fairly useful on Flat, winning three times at up to 14.5f for Harry Eustace, prior to her sale for 40,000gns in October; second favourite for hurdles debut at Doncaster (2m, good) one month ago but the jumping let her down and she was never dangerous, 8l behind Keep On Cobbling; has hopefully learned something and could be more fluent this time; stable among the winners.

quotes.race: Follow @attheraces On Twitter Handicap
quotes.quote: Newbury was a sort of fact-finding mission and we were pleasantly surprised Plus Point was up to winning over a mile and a quarter. We hoped there was improvement up to a mile and a half but, especially against one of Sir Mark's without a penalty, it was a bit of a question. She did it nicely. We were very much on weather watch. I think probably it was a two-way swing in that Sir Mark didn't want rain and we did. The ground is very much as important a factor to her as the trip. This is her time of year now and I hope she continues to improve - Harry Eustace, trainer.

runners.comment: Fair form (1m win) in 2023; 482 days off before tailed off on four Flat runs for new yard
runners.spotlight: Fair form for a 1m Flat win in July 2023; however, absent 482 days before tailed off on her four Flat runs for a new yard this winter.

quotes.race: Visit The Brand New Napoleons Casino Bradford Handicap
quotes.quote: That was very nice but possibly a slightly pleasant surprise because Silk Bird ran atrociously last time and we never found out why. The cheekpieces seem to have helped and dropping back to a stiff mile must have helped a bit. We rode her like she seemed to favour in the past, racing prominently. But last time she just seemed to hate the job and today she seemed to love it. I can't explain it - Jedd O'Keeffe, trainer.

runners.comment: 25-1 when tailed off in a Flat novice at Kempton (1m3f, AW) last July for David Menuisier
runners.spotlight: Flat bred; 25-1 when tailed off in a Flat novice at Kempton (1m3f, AW) last July; has since changed hands and left David Menuisier.

runners.comment: Modest maiden on Flat but behind on all three starts for this yard
runners.spotlight: Modest maiden on Flat, twice placed (1m2f, AW) for Rae Guest last August, but behind on all three starts for this yard; sometimes hooded, including on this hurdle debut.

runners.breeder: Ecurie Des Vives Terres & Pa Ouvry
runners.comment: Low-level form; 12l second of five to a 1-4 winner at Exeter (2m, good to firm) latest
runners.spotlight: Low-level form in her bumper and two maiden hurdles, beaten 12l when second of five to a 1-4 winner at Exeter (2m, good to firm) last time; chance in this weak race.

runners.comment: 125-1 third of ten to a 1-5 favourite over C&D (good) 15 days ago, despite weakening badly
runners.spotlight: Flat form deteriorated in Ireland (fair at best but not after last January) and unseated in her only hurdle race there; 125-1 third of ten to a 1-5 favourite over C&D (good) 15 days ago was much more encouraging even though she weakened badly in the closing stages, so she's one to consider.

racecards.race_name: Racecourse Streams On Racing TV Extra Handicap Chase

runners.comment: Drew clear to open chasing account at Huntingdon last month; respected
runners.spotlight: Off the mark over fences at sixth attempt, drawing clear to score by over 9l at Huntingdon (2m7f, good to soft) last month; went up 8lb for that but today's trip-and-ground combination should also suit and he was placed (over hurdles) on his only previous visit to Stratford; respected.

runners.comment: Struggled on heavy ground last time but won gamely when upped to 3m5f two starts ago
runners.spotlight: Struggled to cope with heavy ground when last in action but was evidently well suited by the move up to a marathon trip when battling well for narrow win at Fakenham (3m5f, good to soft) in December and is only 1lb higher here; contender if handling today's faster ground.

quotes.race: Countdown To Cheltenham At Rhino.Bet Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Samourai One had schooled very well and was very professional and accurate. He outstayed them in the end and that was a perfect start over fences - Justin Wadham, assistant to trainer Lucy Wadham.

runners.comment: Ran well for a long way at Hereford in February and is eased in grade here
runners.spotlight: Three-time cross-country chase winner in France in 2021 and a hurdle winner for Dan Skelton in spring 2023; returned from long absence with two poor hurdle runs for new stable this winter but ran well for a long way when back over fences at Hereford (3m1f, soft) in February and is sure to appreciate today's ease in grade; worth a second look.

runners.comment: Good-ground specialist who was placed off much-reduced mark at Chepstow (3m6f) last month
runners.spotlight: Good-ground specialist; well below best form since returning from a break last spring but was placed off his much-reduced mark at Chepstow (3m6f, good; refitted cheekpieces) last month and has possibilities here.

quotes.race: Bet £10 Get £10 With Vickers.Bet Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Pottlerath won very well. He's not massive so rushing him wouldn't be what he'd want. He can go round here all summer now and I'm sure there will be another race for him - Stan Sheppard, jockey.

quotes.race: Every Race Live On Racing TV Novices' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Pottlerath has been given bad press because he's been placed so many times but I don't think he's ungenuine, just a little bit tricky. I've always had faith he would win - he's been so consistent and just bumped into better handicapped horses. The better ground made a big difference to him. He's very straightforward to train - he's not very big but he's epic and very quick over his hurdles - Matt Sheppard, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's out of training at the moment and won't be back until the spring. He needs fastish ground but he's been a good servant. He's won six times for us over hurdles and fences and been placed a number of times too. We thought he wasn't quite right this year but he finally put in a good run when fourth at Stratford in late August. Then we had a bit of an issue that caused a setback. 28-11-24

runners.comment: Ran well in defeat in February, after a break, and remains unexposed over marathon trips
runners.spotlight: Returned to form with win at Worcester (2m7f, good) last September and ran big race from the front when close second at Doncaster (3m2f, good) in February, after a break; still unexposed over marathon trips; shortlisted.

runners.breeder: Mrs L & Mr J Grandchamp Des Raux
runners.comment: Went very close at Southwell (3m) in February and tackles this new trip from the same mark
runners.spotlight: Won over 2m3f here in 2023 and returns here after finishing second on consecutive outings during the winter; rallied well after penultimate-fence stumble at Southwell (3m, good to soft) on latter occasion, losing out only by a short head, and tackles this new trip from the same mark.

quotes.race: Re-Gen Waste Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Martalmix'jac hinted he's got ability many times. We've gone to the races on the back of good runs thinking, 'Today is the day', then he's put a stinker in. He seems to like it around here and has put it all together. It wasn't the strongest race, but you've still got to win them. He was going away at the line and this was probably his perfect trip. He's not one to be slogging around in the mud. He wants summer jumping, but he might be able to nick one before his season is out. He should go in again - Alex Edwards, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He's turned into a really consistent campaigner, having been a little nondescript to start with. He was quite a closed book in knowing what ground he preferred and even his ideal distance, but he's turned into a very consistent sort. We can place him where he can be most competitive and he keeps pulling it out of the bag in those handicap chases around 2m4f. 16-01-25

runners.comment: Poor maiden who can't be recommended
runners.spotlight: Unplaced all ten starts under rules; never on terms when 80-1 for Huntingdon handicap chase (2m7f, good) last month and is effectively only 1lb lower from out of the weights here; can't be recommended.

racecards.race_name: Alan Adcock 90th Birthday Celebration Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Out of form over hurdles and on the Flat since the autumn; tries a new trip here
runners.spotlight: Not seen over hurdles since two disappointing runs in the autumn (2m4f/2m5f) and his subsequent Flat form has also been disappointing; tries a new trip here; needs to turn a corner.

runners.breeder: Mrs D Dewbery & Mrs B Woodcock
runners.comment: Quirky customer; has conditions to suit but was out of form last summer when last seen
runners.spotlight: Very well handicapped on old form and will be well suited by today's trip-and-ground combination but this quirky customer often looks reluctant at the start nowadays, and was out of form last summer when last seen.

quotes.race: racingtv.com Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Presenting Yeats was a bit unlucky to be disqualified at Newton Abbot last time and deserved that. He likes quick ground so we might get another run into him but we'll see - Milton Harris, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He has done little wrong this season, with three wins, a second once and four thirds in his last eight starts, and he's had a short winter break with a view to a spring/summer campaign. I like him a lot as just like the rest of his family he's honest, tough and consistent. 19-01-22

runners.comment: Went close on seasonal debut in October but seems badly to have lost his way since winter
runners.spotlight: Now 9lb lower than when going very close on seasonal debut at Hereford (3m1f, good) in October but seems badly to have lost his way since the winter; back over hurdles after struggling in two recent chases; refitted cheekpieces the headgear of choice today.

runners.comment: Showed minor promise in 2m6f novice here last spring; makes handicap debut today
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in Ffos Las maiden (2m, soft) in January, after a break, but displayed a modicum of promise when third of five (albeit well held) in novice event here (2m6f, good) last spring and, after only three hurdle runs, remains very unexposed; swaps cheekpieces for first-time visor.

runners.comment: Out of sorts in winter when last seen but won this race in 2024; might bounce back to form
runners.spotlight: Won this race a year ago (good to soft), his second start for Mel Rowley, and followed up off today's mark here (2m6f, good) in May; looked out of sorts in the winter when last seen but is still of some interest on return to this track.

stable_tour.quote: He's similar to a few of ours who struggle in this winter ground. We're very mindful of that and he did really well last season to get his head in front twice over hurdles, having come from nothing really. We're looking to place him to do that again and we'll ensure we run him on that better ground. 16-01-25

runners.comment: 0-6 over hurdles but ran quite well over 2m6f last month; more appealing than most
runners.spotlight: 0-6 over hurdles but was only beaten about 7l when fifth of 13 here (2m6f, good to soft) last month and looks well worth a crack at today's longer trip; more appealing than most of these.

runners.comment: Placed twice over fences in late 2024 and ran well again when back hurdling in February
runners.spotlight: Placed twice over fences (3m/3m2f) when cheekpieces were added at end of last year and gave another good account when second (albeit no match for winner) over hurdles at Ffos Las (3m, heavy; no headgear) in February; not sure to be suited by the faster ground here but still considered.

runners.comment: Struggled in first two handicaps; upped in trip with hood added here
runners.spotlight: 0-6 over hurdles; not disgraced in Chepstow maiden (2m3f, good) last month but struggled in two handicaps before that (2m7f/2m5f); upped in trip and fitted with first-time hood here; improvement required.

racecards.race_name: Bet At racingtv.com Novices' Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: 2-4 for new stable since February, having won over hurdles and fences; major player
runners.spotlight: Scored over hurdles on stable debut at Southwell (2m4f, good to soft) in February and returns to this discipline after hard-fought chase success at Sedgefield (2m5f, good) ten days ago; needs to be take very seriously in current mood.

runners.comment: Still unexposed over hurdles but dropped out rather tamely on last month's handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Unexposed after only four hurdling starts but dropped out rather tamely on last month's handicap debut at Southwell (2m4f, good to soft) and needs to take a good step forward here.

runners.comment: 6l winner of modest mares' maiden at Sedgefield this month; makes handicap debut today
runners.spotlight: Came good over hurdles at third attempt, with 6l success in modest mares' maiden at Sedgefield (2m1f, good; first-time cheekpieces) ten days ago; contests a stronger race here but may have further improvement to come in handicaps.

quotes.race: Visit The New betvickers.com Website Mares' Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Land Girl's Luck ran in a three-runner race at Exeter recently and did her best work late on, so we just thought over two miles we'll ride her really positively and let her use her jumping, because she jumps really well even though she's not the biggest. Max [Comley, trainer] thought the cheekpieces would help and they made a big difference - David Bass, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.comment: Back from break with good second over fences last month; can make presence felt again here
runners.spotlight: Won over hurdles at Southwell (2m, good) in the autumn and returned from break with good second over fences at Bangor (2m1f, good) three weeks ago; can make his presence felt again here.

stable_tour.quote: He won a bumper at Musselburgh for Donald Whillans before joining us. He ran well enough in a maiden hurdle at Listowel last month but will come on a ton for that and leave that form well behind. 18-10-22

runners.comment: Showed some hurdling ability in Ireland last year; makes stable/handicap debut today
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish filly who showed some hurdling ability against own age-group last summer/autumn and ought to be suited by the good ground here; hood/tongue-tie removed for this stable/handicap debut; market may guide.

runners.comment: Not beaten far in her latest handicap and today's faster ground will suit
runners.spotlight: 0-6 over hurdles; not favoured by the weights when well beaten in Taunton maiden in February and better judged on her respectable handicap fourth at Bangor (2m3f, soft) two starts ago; 2lb wrong today but the faster ground will suit; not ruled out.

racecards.race_name: Howley Energy & Water Ltd Mares' Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Beat good yardstick in Wetherby novice in February; leading contender on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Built upon her encouraging stable/hurdle debut when beating a good yardstick at Wetherby (2m, soft) in February and looked set to justify very skinny odds before last-flight fall at Catterick (2m, good) last month; leading contender on this handicap debut.

quotes.race: wetherbyracing.co.uk Mares' Novices' Hurdle (Herring Queen Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I know she's my daughter, but Fern had done a fantastic job with Magical Annie. She was very highly strung when she came to us and Fern rides her all the time. I'm really pleased with that and it's lovely to have another winner for the Megsons - Fergal O'Brien, trainer.

runners.comment: Second twice in Ireland last September but pulled up when unsteerable on stable debut
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in two 2m maiden hurdles for Henry de Bromhead in Ireland last September (yielding/good) but was beaten at skinny odds on latter occasion and was pulled up for new stable at Hereford in February, having become unsteerable on the final circuit; risky.

stable_tour.quote: A fun little mare we bought from Ireland, where she ran consistently. She's suited to better ground and will run over hurdles and fences. 19-02-25

runners.comment: Showed promise in all three qualifying races; drops in trip for handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 6yo who shaped with promise in her three qualifying races towards the end of last year, most notably when close fourth at Wincanton (2m5f, soft) on second occasion; drops in trip and encounters much quicker ground on this handicap debut but open to improvement if this different test suits.

runners.comment: Dual hurdle winner; in good form on AW in recent months; big player here
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner who has been in good form on AW in recent months, including very creditable fourth in valuable Winter Oaks at Lingfield (1m2f); reverts to this code on a workable mark and with ground suitable; ought to pose a potent threat.

stable_tour.quote: She's been on the go this summer and has done very well. She won twice over hurdles in May and was also a neck second at Newton Abbot last month, while in between she ran an excellent race on the Flat at Goodwood, looking the likely winner two furlongs out but not quite staying the mile and a half. She can continue under both codes until the winter. 22-10-24

racecards.race_name: Racing TV Open Hunters' Chase

runners.owner: The Stay Between The Ditches Syndicate
runners.comment: Won a point and Fakenham hunter chase this year; found it tough at Cheltenham and Aintree
runners.spotlight: Won a point and a Fakenham hunter chase in February; found it tough at big odds in the top hunter chases at Cheltenham and Aintree but this task is much more realistic.

quotes.race: Albert Bartlett Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (Registered As The Spa Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We're delighted with the run. The ground was probably a bit slow for Bardenstown Lad, but he's a big chaser in the making - Derek Kierans, connections' representative.

quotes.race: 888Sport What's Your Thinking Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a good performance in the end. Bardenstown Lad raced very lazily early on and when I gave him a reminder at the top of the hill he came back on it [the bridle], winged the last three hurdles and he's gone and done it well.  I was all out at 1-10 at Cartmel and I thought I was going to get beat halfway round as he's just that type of horse. He might need headgear later on in his life but something like the Albert Bartlett is a race you need a real stayer in and he is that. I hope John's hoping that's what he can be - Sean Bowen, rider.

stable_tour.quote: I'm going to get him fully checked out after his run at Cheltenham over the weekend as it's not just his jumping over fences that is an issue - he's not really travelling either. Maybe he really doesn't like chasing but he was bought as a point-to-pointer so we'd expect him to be fine in that regard. He's also schooled well at home and the engine is still there because he works very well. I wouldn't be too worried yet. 21-11-22

prev_owners.owner: W J and T C O Gredley

runners.comment: Unable to get near front in the big Cheltenham hunter chase (20-1); should go well here
