runners.spotlight: Very smart at his best under rules, still pretty useful over hurdles last year and a dual point winner this winter; best known as a front-runner, so not being able to get near the head of affairs may help to explain things when he was pulled up after only one circuit in the big Cheltenham hunter chase (20-1) one month ago; he should go well today.

quotes.race: Jewson Monet's Garden Old Roan Limited Handicap Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm very proud of Allmankind. To win a handicap on that mark out of novices at a tender age is pretty good. He races a bit differently now, but he did that up at Ayr the backend of last season. You'll see a lot less of him. I think because he's doing it now out of novices and proving it, you've got to be a bit respectful and not empty the well. I'll talk to the owners and see what they want to do but ultimately you've got to come back for the Melling. He might not run this side of Christmas - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Geoffrey Broomhall Memorial Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: With a big jump at the last Allmankind would have been closer, but he's been caught out by two closers and that's how the race was run. I came here with no expectations. I said he'd really need the run because we're going to Aintree for the Old Roan and if we didn't run, we'd have been in big trouble. He improves for his first run so much and we thought he was a tap in at Cheltenham on his comeback last year, but he was beaten. He's big and burly and is a bit harder to get fit. Those front-runners end up starting to wait for other horses and he works a little like that - as they get older, they get wiser. Two and a half miles is right up his street and I can't wait for Aintree - we had to come here today to have any chance of winning there - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Jordan Electrics Ltd Future Champion Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Allmankind is a funny type of horse. At the start of the season he's all hot air and exuberance, and he's exciting to watch. As the season progresses he gets a little lazier and he's been lazier at home. But his only chance of lasting and making into an older horse is by racing like that and it bodes really well for the future. I was very taken with the performance. Malystic looked a real threat turning in and Allmankind has gone away. I think he stays well and he could get any trip - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Planteur At Chapel Stud Henry VIII Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Allmankind was magic today, very good down the back. He has won two Grade 1s now and has an exciting future. He jumped a little to his left but it was his first run right-handed - Harry Skelton, jockey.

quotes.race: Coral Finale Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Allmankind is a bit one dimensional as you cannot ride him any other way and when he first came to the yard I did not think he had the edge for jumping but he loves it. I suppose something like the Victor Ludorum at Haydock or a trip to Leopardstown for a Grade 1 hurdle might be on the cards for him next -Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: JCB Triumph Trial Juvenile Hurdle (Registered As The Prestbury Juvenile Hurdle) (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Obviously we will aim to come back here in March. Allmankind is good enough to have a place in that [the JCB Triumph Hurdle], and he's tough - nothing will get to him in the meantime, if that makes sense. I can't see why he needs more experience and that type of thing, so we can just plan backwards from there. I should imagine one race before then - Dan Skelton, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's won his two open point-to-points for Jenny, which qualifies him. He settled well in those two races and jumped nicely for Alex Chadwick, who works with me and is the champion amateur. It was Tim Gredley's idea to do this and I think he's got every chance. Whether he stays those final two furlongs is the big question, but he'll run a big race. 18-2-25

runners.breeder: S C E A De Maulde
runners.comment: Won points this year and beaten a nose in five-runner hunter chase at Newbury (2m7f)
runners.spotlight: Useful handicap chaser for James Ewart before long absences stalled his progress; back to winning ways in points this year and beaten a nose in five-runner hunter chase at Newbury (2m7f) three weeks ago, so he should have a serious chance in this line-up.

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing Virgin 535 Novices' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Empire De Maulde was disappointing the last day, but he's switched off today, jumped well and been a bit green in front - Steven Fox, jockey.

runners.comment: Second of five in a C&D hunter chase last May but he probably needs better to win this
runners.spotlight: Sole win under rules was in 2021; kept almost exclusively to point-to-points since, winning four of 12 and runner-up in his last two outings; also second of five in a C&D hunter chase last May but he probably needs better to win this.

runners.comment: Third of six in this race last year; now a 13yo and losing spell goes back to April 2022
runners.spotlight: Third of six in this race last year and also third at Cheltenham last May; lesser efforts both starts since, perhaps needing the latest after ten months off but he's now 13 and his losing spell goes back to April 2022.

quotes.race: Follow At The Races On Twitter Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Solomon Grey has done really well round here in the past and it's good to get his head in front. He's won over 2m a couple of times, but I think this is his trip, and he jumped great. I'm delighted for his owner Sarah Faulks. It's a difficult time for everyone at the minute. He was 2nd in the Lanzarote and has knocked on the door in some nice races, and it's great to see him get his head in front - Harry Skelton, rider.

quotes.race: In Play Betting At 188Bet Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Solomon Grey is progressive. He is still a bit novicey as he races a bit behind the bridle and was pulling up with me there. He will be suited by better ground and there could be a nice race in him this spring, but he'll be an even better horse next year - Harry Skelton, jockey.

quotes.race: Strong Flavours Catering Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: Solomon Grey has been a bit unlucky to bump into really nice horses and I probably didn't ride him very well at Fontwell when I made a lot of use of him. He is going the right way and didn't really handle the track that well today going downhill on the far side but he came home well. He could run next in a race at Kempton on Boxing Day and he will make a nice chaser - Harry Skelton, jockey.

racecards.race_name: McCreery Military Forces Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle (For Military Amateur Jockeys)

stable_tour.quote: I was glad we got him back at the Chris Giles dispersal sale as he's a novice hurdle winner waiting to happen, judged on his one run for us at Taunton in March. He's had a wind op and should be ready from the middle of this month. 04-11-24

prev_owners.owner: Ian Chanin, Tom Hooper, Peter Kingwell & Mark Booth

quotes.race: Premier League Offers At Rhino.Bet Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's a shame Doc McCoy didn't win his bumper, but he has always been a proper jumper. He is an embryonic chaser as he won a point-to-point at Great Trethew. He bowled along in front when he won his point-to-point so we thought we would let him bowl along and make it a test. We could aim him at the EBF Final at Sandown in March. That  is probably his kind of race as it suits proper staying chasers. That will probably be his target - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won on his hurdling debut before finishing fourth under a penalty, but he picked up an injury soon afterwards. He's back from a break and will go novice chasing. 06-11-24

Novice hurdling is the plan for him and he jumps well, while he performed to a good level in his bumpers, finishing in the places on all three starts. It was a shame he didn't win one, but Datsalrightgino didn't either. 28-09-23

runners.owner: Mr And Mrs J D Cotton

stable_tour.quote: He's one of the 22 four-year-olds who were bought unraced at the sales and have come through their pre-training down the road from here with Will Biddick. He's one we like, judged on his work this autumn, and he ran okay at Ascot on Saturday, travelling like the winner as they turned for home before flattening out a bit. 05-11-23

prev_owners.owner: The Brooks Family And J Kyle

stable_tour.quote: He was tongue-tied for his bumper debut last season, when he ran green but showed promise, and he made a noise when fading next time. So he had corrective surgery on his wind in the spring and that should help now he's novice hurdling. But he was still very green and backward when a close third at Plumpton last month. He'll keep improving with further experience. 04-11-24

runners.breeder: E A R L Trinquet & M & O Trinquet
runners.owner: A Keaveney, M Keaveney & P Butcher
Exors Of The Late D I Bare

quotes.race: Jumps Season Ultimate Guide At attheraces.com Mares' Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: Kentford Mallard has definitely improved for her summer holidays. It was a hell of a run at Chepstow and she's improved again. She's a bit quirky but I got a good jump at the last, which I needed - Kevin Jones, jockey.

racecards.race_name: racingtv.com Novices' Handicap Chase

prev_owners.owner: R P Behan & J J Lambe

stable_tour.quote: He shaped with encouragement on his last bumper run. He's grown and filled out since and has the ability to go far over hurdles. 19-10-21

quotes.race: JenningsBet Devizes 'National Hunt' Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Universal Secret is a big baby. He's growing all the time and is a chaser, but we knew he'd win a hurdle race. We won't do anything fancy but he'll go chasing next season - Helen Nelmes, trainer.

runners.comment: Unraced over a trip this short but it's worth a go and he's considered
runners.spotlight: Short-headed in a maiden point, while second on chase debut at Market Rasen (2m5f, good) in November was clearly his best result from eight races under rules; tongue tied that day and all three starts since, two of which were respectable; off more than three months before latest; unraced over a trip this short but it's worth a go and he's seriously considered.

prev_owners.owner: Exors D Cocks & S Livesey-Van Dorst
D Cocks & Mrs S Livesey-Van Dorst

quotes.race: Harry And Betty Savill Memorial Novices' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I think Mawlood was unlucky his last few runs and Phil told be he had an each-way chance. We got a good posi and then it's just about keeping him going forward as he's not the quickest. With a circuit to go I was half off the bridle and yet I've ended up taking it up sooner than I'd have liked but I didn't want to disappoint him. I was surprised how well I was going turning in and he galloped all the way to the line - Shane Quinlan, rider.

racecards.race_name: Follow @racingtv On X Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

stable_tour.quote: I was glad we got him back at the Chris Giles dispersal sale as he's a novice hurdle winner waiting to happen, judged on his one run for us at Taunton in March. He's had a wind op and should be ready from the middle of this month. 04-11-24

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late C J Leech
Derrick Smith & Michael Tabor & Mrs John Magnier
Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
Derrick Smith & Michael Tabor & Mrs John Magnier

stable_tour.quote: Another of the French imports, who was bought at the Arqana Sale in July. He won his only Flat start at two for Andre Fabre, but rather lost his way this year. We've gelded him and he's recently back from a wind op, so won't be out in juvenile hurdles until after Christmas. 04-11-24

racecards.race_name: Watch On Racing TV Handicap Hurdle

stable_tour.quote: He's a solid English point-to-pointer and we're waiting for a handicap mark to go chasing. I like him and think he's all right. 19-11-24

quotes.race: Alpha Aggregates Handicap Hurdle (For Female Amateur Jockeys)
quotes.quote: I couldn't ask for a better horse to have my first (rules) winner on. I've looked after Whatsupwithyou ever since I started at Ben's so it's quite special really. This is my fifth season so I've looked after him for four years. It's quite nice to ride him, let alone win on him - Megan Fox, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: eventmasters.co.uk Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Whatsupwithyou is always on the go and always wants to get on with things, that's why he was ridden with a bit of patience today but he jumped his way there. David (Bass) said he knew he had plenty of horse turning in to go and win - Tom David, assistant trainer

stable_tour.quote: A lovely horse who rounded off last season with a battling win at Uttoxeter over hurdles. Prior to that he had finished second at Cheltenham, as well as other good, placed efforts. He is still on a good handicap mark (122 ) and hopefully he can go on from there. I'd like to think he will progress over hurdles. 26-10-22

She scoped with mucus after running at Stratford last week, but Adam Wedge said she gave him a nice feel and he couldn't believe she stopped. She was treated for ataxia after the race, but I imagine that's because she was full of mucus and couldn't get any oxygen in. 02-11-22

She's a good-ground mare who's back in cantering after having a holiday. She's as hard as nails but not overly big and is much better running in a better race with less weight. I'm not sure she genuinely stays 3m and her ideal trip is probably a good gallop over 2m6f. She's a good jumper and I wouldn't rule out going back over fences. 29-01-25

quotes.race: Howden Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Wicked Thoughts liked that back down in trip and, like a few of ours, he wasn't quite right before, but he looked great in his coat. He's not a big, heavy horse, but he skipped off that ground and he loved it. He jumped really well. His form at Exeter on fast ground, when he gave weight away to Nicky's [Henderson's] horse [Kingston Pride], who was actually all right, it made me think he'd have a good chance - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We went quietly with him in bumpers last season, giving him more time to mature. He made a promising start to his hurdling career when just run out of it at Southwell last month, and I'll be looking for him to step up on that when he reappears. He's a decent, fun horse. 04-11-24

runners.breeder: E A R L Les Bordes De Mornay Et Al

quotes.race: Download The PlanetSportBet App Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: He's been working away nicely with the horse that won at Ascot on Saturday (Regent's Stroll). We'll have one run in the spring and that'll do for Jackpot Des Bordes this season - something like the Listed bumper at Newbury on Denman Chase day (February 10). He's a nice horse and one for the future - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was let down by novicey jumping when only sixth on his hurdling debut at Exeter, so it's back to the drawing board. He's not over-big, so we need to sharpen up his jumping. We'll give him plenty more schooling - despite the fact he's been jumping the best part of two years - and he should be sharper next time. His winning bumper debut last season was nothing less than we expected, and he stepped up when narrowly touched off by a promising sort at Wincanton who has come out and won over hurdles. He's well up to winning, provided we keep him at the right level. 04-11-24

quotes.race: Champion Hats Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's taken a while for the penny to drop. Balboa has had two runs but he still had a look at the first (hurdle). We got a bit of good fortune with the non-runners but that's racing and you've got to kick the ball when it's in front of you. He's ok and he's solid, he seems to handle the soft ground. We might turn up at the Cheltenham meeting in November, although we do have some higher rated who could go there. Milton Harris, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He's new to me this season and I was worried before his first run on the Flat because he'd shown me nothing in his work but he ran a perfectly sound race and has another run at Nottingham on Wednesday. He will return to hurdling later this season and he showed some decent form last season. 07-11-24

She showed a similar level of form in her three bumpers last season; she failed to get a clear run when getting off the mark at Taunton, so deserves extra credit. She recently sustained a small cut while on the walker, so is still a month to six weeks off a run. She goes mares' novice hurdling. 04-11-24

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late C J Leech

racecards.race_name: Racing TV Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap Chase (Go North Red Rum Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: My Gift To You has never actually won like that [from that far out] before.  When we've tried to make all in his previous races he's overraced, and it's taken a while to get him to settle and into a rhythm.  We were going to sit behind until halfway today, but he's not a horse you can disappoint.  He's very versatile in terms of trip and going - Alex Chadwick, rider, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: My Gift To You is a great, lovely horse. He caught my eye at the sales and there were a couple of trainers after him because he's good-looking, but I wanted him when I started training because we could do a good job with him. He's improving and getting stronger. We probably rushed him in the summer trying to beat the handicapper and he needed time to develop - James Owen, trainer, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He'd shown very little form when I bought him at Ascot sales for£8,000. He's a very good-looking, well-bred horse and he won his first start for us over hurdles, then won a chase the next start and came back from a little break to score again on his second start over fences. He's a big baby and very much a horse for the future. 06-12-23

quotes.race: JenningsBet Devizes 'National Hunt' Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Universal Secret is a big baby. He's growing all the time and is a chaser, but we knew he'd win a hurdle race. We won't do anything fancy but he'll go chasing next season - Helen Nelmes, trainer.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De Lonray

quotes.race: Payne Crop Nutrition Ltd Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: We thought going out on to the last circuit that Elpologreg would get there as the others went off too fast, but that has to be the ride of the season - Seamus Mullins, trainer.

racecards.race_name: Dot Tolson Memorial Handicap Chase

prev_owners.owner: Jan Johnson&yor Gunna Be Lucky Syndicate

runners.breeder: Messrs M E & A D I Harris

quotes.race: Racing TV Black Friday Offer - Join For Just 12 Euros PM For An Entire Year Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Tactical Affair is a lovely horse and he will come on a lot. He's a fine big horse and only coming into himself - Jordan Gainford, rider.

stable_tour.quote: Ran reasonably well in the big sales bumper at Punchestown. He might start off in a bumper before going novice hurdling. 24-10-23

quotes.race: Play Low6 Picks At low6.com Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Romanor has got to be ridden like that, he just wants to run away with you the whole time, so you have just got to ride him chilly effectively and do everything as late as possible. For some reason he absolutely adores this place - Danny Sansom, jockey.

quotes.race: starsportsbet.co.uk Handicap
quotes.quote: It worked out well in the end. Romanor was a bit keen early and then the pace quickened and he was caught a bit flat footed. It was only in the last 100 yards I thought he'd win but if he hadn't wasted the energy earlier he'd have won easier. He got a bit agitated on the way down but he went on the ground. He'll make a nice jumper for someone - Jamie Spencer, jockey.

quotes.race: JenningsBet Devizes 'National Hunt' Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Universal Secret is a big baby. He's growing all the time and is a chaser, but we knew he'd win a hurdle race. We won't do anything fancy but he'll go chasing next season - Helen Nelmes, trainer.

racecards.race_name: Join Racing TV Now Mares' Handicap Hurdle

quotes.race: Visit The New betvickers.com Website Mares' Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Land Girl's Luck ran in a three-runner race at Exeter recently and did her best work late on, so we just thought over two miles we'll ride her really positively and let her use her jumping, because she jumps really well even though she's not the biggest. Max [Comley, trainer] thought the cheekpieces would help and they made a big difference - David Bass, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

prev_owners.owner: Mr And Mrs J D Cotton
Agv Karwin Stud, Chauvigny Global Equine Sasu Et Al

stable_tour.quote: I don't think she wants the ground as soft as it was at Warwick on Tuesday and just weakened when you didn't want her to. She shaped like a horse with lots of ability and will come on a bundle for it. 02-11-22

runners.owner: D Edmonston, T Helliwell & Leon Best

prev_owners.owner: D Edmonston, T Helliwell & John Moynihan
D Edmonston, T Helliwell, If Only Ptr

quotes.race: John Benstead Handicap (A Jockey Club Grassroots Middle Distance Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Arenas Del Tiempo wears her heart on her sleeve and is going in the right direction. She's rangey and can get a bit excitable, but I think she can go on with another winter under her belt. She's suited to Epsom - the twists and turns - and I'm already thinking what we can do with her here next year - Simon Dow, trainer.

quotes.race: Twickenham Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: I thought Arenas Del Tiempo would lead as Hollie Doyle changed the whole game plan with the lovely ride she gave her to win at Brighton. She's at the right end of the handicap to still be learning and it's exciting to see what she can do now. We'll look to keep her to courses that suit this style and our 'home' track at Epsom would be perfect for her. Something at the August Bank Holiday fixture might be just what she wants - Simon Dow, trainer.

prev_owners.owner: Middleham Park Racing CXXVI & Les Boyer

stable_tour.quote: I think she is quite nice and I was delighted with her first run of the year when successful over 1m2f at Newcastle. She went off at 25-1 but was not a complete surprise to us as she had always looked decent at home, although she did carry a bit of condition on the day and I thought she would come on a lot for that run. PJ [McDonald] said they went a nice pace and when taking it up 2f out she kept finding more which is always an encouraging sign. Unfortunately, she had a little setback after that win and we have had to give her some time off. We had hoped to go for an Oaks Trial but that was scuppered and I she is still about six weeks off a return to the track. She is by a good sire and has a nice pedigree, so we are keen to try and get her up to Black Type level, which she has the potential for. She has won over 1m2f which is ideal for her but who knows she could get further. 07-07-21

racecards.race_name: Kalkmann-Fruhjahrs-Meile (Group 3) (4yo+) (Turf)

quotes.race: Irish Thoroughbred Marketing Cup (Local Group 2) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Everyone adores Brave Emperor, he's a credit to the team and I'm running out of superlatives to describe him. I love the word 'dude', you send him anywhere in the world and he still runs his race - he's such a hero. I thought Cairo was going to come and have a big say, but Luke (Morris, jockey) absolutely nailed that. He's A Monster coming out slightly changed our plan because he was going to be our pace angle, but Luke adapted perfectly. You need a willing partner and there's nobody better than Brave Emperor, who nailed the kick and had it won a long way out - Tim Palin, owner's representative.

quotes.race: Prix Daphnis - Fonds Europeen de l'Elevage - Prix Famille Saleh-Selman (Group 3)(3yo)(Round)(Turf)
quotes.quote: Brave Emperor surprised me. He went into the last two furlongs travelling so strongly and he ground it out lovely to the line when the others came to him. He's a two-time Group 3 winner now and hopefully something a bit better might be ahead. This was his last time to stay in his own age group and we were going to find out how good he is. You'd imagine races like the Daniel Wildenstein on Arc weekend would come into it. I was quite concerned about the soft ground but I felt he improved on today's surface, so it wouldn't bother me going into the autumn on some deep ground - Luke Morris, jockey.

racecards.race_name: Advancing Culture & Sports Handicap (Class 3) (3yo+) (Course C) (Turf)

runners.comment: 1m2f course winner last month and again finished well when close second over C&D last time
runners.spotlight: Ex-British 4yo; safely held on first two Hong Kong starts, but stayed on from long way off the pace to win over 1m2f here last month and again finished well when close second to Packing Turbine over C&D three weeks ago; must be considered.

quotes.race: Download The Raceday Ready App Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: James Webb is still a little bit raw. You can see he's a big horse. I think the flat track today made all the difference - P J McDonald, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.comment: Dual 7f winner this term and stayed on well for third over C&D when up in trip last month
runners.spotlight: Dual 7f course winner this season and belied 65-1 odds when staying on strongly for third behind Packing Turbine and Enthralled over C&D three weeks ago; could still have untapped potential over this trip.

runners.comment: Opened Hong Kong account with ready C&D win last month; might progress again
runners.spotlight: Rather inconsistent during this first Hong Kong season, but opened local account with ready C&D success three weeks ago and could quite plausibly have more to offer.

runners.comment: Surprise dirt winner in December but out of form on that surface since
runners.spotlight: Caused 44-1 surprise on dirt here (1m) in December, but all three runs on that surface this year have been underwhelming and he looks risky on this turf return.

quotes.race: Cazoo Handicap
quotes.quote: Swilcan Bridge handled the course well. He had a run here earlier in the year and had run very well at Goodwood last time out. He crept into the Royal Hunt Cup, actually, today, but when you've got the opportunity to run for this sort of prize-money, if he's going to take a 10lb hike it doesn't matter. You're just thrilled to have a winner on Derby Day - Andrew Balding, trainer.

runners.comment: Dual dirt winner this season but ran poorly last time and remains on tough mark
runners.spotlight: Dual dirt winner this season (1m1f/1m) but ran poorly on that surface 18 days ago and remains on a tough mark for this turf return; younger rivals appeal much more.

runners.comment: Took big step back in right direction when fourth over C&D last month; still well treated
runners.spotlight: Generally in poor form this season, but took big step back in right direction when keeping-on fourth over C&D three weeks ago, his second start for David Eustace; remains very well handicapped.

runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Horatio Ho Yiu Wing, Ho Garrick Sai Man & H L S Kit
runners.comment: Dual course winner this term (7f/1m) and open to more improvement over this new trip
runners.spotlight: Steadily progressive 4yo who doubled his tally with ready 1m course win last month; would probably have preferred a stronger pace to aim at when fifth over that trip last week and remains open to further improvement on this first attempt at 1m1f.

runners.breeder: S F Bloodstock L L C
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Edward Hung & Doris Hung
runners.comment: Ended 2024 with two Class 4 C&D wins and is holding his own in this higher grade
runners.spotlight: Ended last season with two Class 4 C&D wins and both runs in this higher grade this year (7f/1m) were perfectly respectable; back up to his ideal trip today and considered each-way.

runners.comment: Encountered traffic when sixth over C&D last month; better judged on previous 1m second
runners.spotlight: Unexposed after only four runs in Hong Kong and went close over 1m here two starts ago; encountered traffic when only sixth in recent C&D race won by Packing Turbine but remains very much of interest.

runners.comment: Non-runner
runners.spotlight: Non-runner.

runners.comment: Placed over C&D this season but others in the line-up have more convincing profiles
runners.spotlight: Useful handicapper at around 1m when based in Britain and has been placed over C&D this season; needs to rebound from a poor run three weeks ago, though, and others in the field have more convincing profiles.

quotes.race: Betfred 'Bet Builder' Sankey Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: I've always thought a lot of Liveandletlive. If he goes up high enough to get in the Britannia I'll take him to Ascot - William Muir, joint-trainer.

runners.owner: Sherman T W Cheung, Tina T T Yan & Joyce T T Sum
runners.comment: Up in grade after last month's ready C&D win but may still have more improvement to come
runners.spotlight: Improving 4yo who won readily over C&D four weeks ago and is now 2-6; moves up in grade today but ought to give another good account.

runners.owner: Ngai Man, Amy Wang Hong & Doris Ngai Yan Tung
runners.comment: In good form over today's trip but will probably find at least a couple better handicapped
runners.spotlight: Consistent 5yo who deserved his Class 4 win at Happy Valley in February and has since been placed there in this higher grade; will probably find at least a couple better handicapped today, though.

racecards.race_name: Sustainability Handicap (Class 3) (3yo+) (Course C) (Turf)

runners.owner: Bryan Kwan Hon Ming, Jessica Kwan Mun Hang Et Al
runners.comment: In good form but has a wide draw and is on a tough mark
runners.spotlight: Dual course winner in early part of this season (7f/1m); stayed on well for fifth over C&D a fortnight ago but has another wide draw today and remains on a tough mark.

runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Boniface Ho Ka Kui
runners.comment: Disappointed on both starts this year and now has a point to prove
runners.spotlight: Began Hong Kong career with three good C&D runs (one win) towards end of 2024, but has disappointed on both appearances this year and now has a point to prove.

runners.comment: Very progressive 4yo who made all over C&D when upped in trip last month and is now 3-4
runners.spotlight: Very progressive 4yo who made all over C&D when upped in trip last month and is now 3-4; commands respect.

runners.comment: Placed off new mark since emphatic C&D win in February and not yet fully exposed
runners.spotlight: Ex-Australian 4yo who came good in Hong Kong with emphatic C&D success in February and was placed off today's mark over 1m last month; not drawn well today but may still have a bigger run in him; leading contender.

runners.breeder: A W Jones & Mrs E W Morris
runners.comment: C&D winner last month and did very well to go very close a fortnight later; respected
runners.spotlight: Opened Hong Kong account with narrow C&D win last month and did very well to go very close here a fortnight later, having lost significant ground at the start; must be considered in current form.

runners.comment: Held on well for narrow C&D win last month but 5lb rise probably leaves him vulnerable
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner this season, latterly when clinging on by a short head to thwart Armour War Eagle three weeks ago; evidently in very good nick but recent 5lb rise probably leaves him vulnerable.

quotes.race: Jenningsbet British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Endeared\ was a bit unlucky not to have won before today. He got stuck in the mud last time at Chester and everything just caught him out but I think the winner (Frankness) is a good filly. He's off to Hong Kong now and his owner Ben Wong is a big supporter of mine. He was purchased as a yearling but you have to get them qualified to run out there. That was more stressful than trying to win a Group race. I'm sure he will do very well out there - James Fanshawe, trainer.

runners.breeder: K D Landrigan & P J Landrigan
runners.comment: 1m Listed winner in New Zealand last May but not seen again since
runners.spotlight: Delivered on debut promise when winning 1m Listed race in New Zealand last May, but makes Hong Kong debut after 11-month absence and has wide draw; probably best watched.

prev_owners.owner: D Bishop P Robinson S Bland T Coyle

runners.comment: Made quite promising Hong Kong debut last month (6f); needs to build on that effort
runners.spotlight: Dual 6f 2yo winner in Britain last year; made quite encouraging Hong Kong debut when seventh at Happy Valley (6f) last month but needs to take a good step forward.

runners.comment: Ended 2024 with two Class 4 wins (6f/7f) and probably still has potential
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 3yo who ended 2024 with two narrow wins in Class 4 (6f/7f); faces a tougher assignment in this higher grade but probably still has potential.

runners.owner: Rotary Club of Sha Tin Syndicate
runners.comment: Lurks on a tempting mark but has not been firing on all cylinders in recent months
runners.spotlight: Lurks on a tempting mark but has not been firing on all cylinders in recent months and is drawn on the outside.

runners.comment: Always towards rear when a big-priced outsider for first two Hong Kong starts
runners.spotlight: Always towards rear when a big-priced outsider for first two Hong Kong starts (both 6f); can't be recommended.

runners.comment: Held his own when back up in this grade last month but others in the line-up look stronger
runners.spotlight: 6f course winner last month; held his own when back up in this grade three weeks ago and will be suited by today's return to 7f, but others in this line-up look stronger.

prev_owners.owner: Sean Jones & Mrs L Lyons & Mrs A Brudenell & R Simmons

runners.comment: In the frame over C&D on three of last four outings; probably won't be far away
runners.spotlight: In the frame over C&D on three of last four appearances, most recently when very close third behind Endeared three weeks ago; well drawn and probably won't be far away.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series (C & G) Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: He's a lovely horse who has done it well at home for a long time. He was only ready to start. He loved that ground and Colin [Keane] said he wouldn't want it any quicker. That trip and further [suits him], he'll have no problem getting a trip. He did that well and showed a good attitude, he'll only improve. He's a good-looking horse who we're delighted with - Shane Lyons, assistant to Ger Lyons, trainer of To Glory

prev_owners.owner: Miss D M Guy & Mrs G V Guy

runners.comment: Yet to show anything more than minor promise after three Hong Kong runs
runners.spotlight: 6f maiden winner in New Zealand last May but yet to show anything more than minor promise after three Hong Kong runs (5f-6f) and is now eligible for a drop in grade.

runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Dannis Lee Cheuk Yin
runners.comment: Very respectable sixth from wide draw when back up in grade last month (6f); not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Ran on strongly to win a shade cosily over 6f when dropped to Class 4 last month and has since performed well from a tough draw in this higher grade; also suited by 7f; not ruled out each-way.

runners.comment: Two wins this season; needs to get back on track after two below-par runs
runners.spotlight: Two wins this term, the latter from the front in January (1m); not fully exposed but needs to get back on track after two below-par runs.

racecards.race_name: Racing For Charity Plate (Griffin) (2yo+) (Course C) (Turf)

runners.comment: Busy in the barrier trials, hinting that a little more time and distance will suit
runners.spotlight: A son of Fastnet Rock, whose stock have done well in Hong Kong; nicely bred but is likely to come into his own when tacking at least 7f; he has been busy in the barrier trials, hinting that a little more time and distance will suit.

runners.comment: Won a small-field turf trial (4f) on Monday; bred for speed and has to be considered
runners.spotlight: Won a modest turf trial (4f) at Conghua this week; there is plenty of speed in his pedigree, being by Land Force and out of an Invincible Spirit mare; enters calculations.

runners.comment: Four barrier trials this year have not shown him to be a naturally speedy; pedigree agrees
runners.spotlight: Four barrier trials this year have failed to show him to be a natural speedster; that view is generally supported by his family tree, being the product of Oasis Dream and a Dubai Destination mare whose influence seems to be for 7f and beyond.

runners.comment: Two turf barrier trials (4f/5f) suggest he has inherited his family's speed genes; player
runners.spotlight: Comes from a family which has speed as its core element - sire Pierata Brown had nine wins from 5.5f to 7f; dam Dream Free has already produced a five-time sprint winner and is from a family of quality sprinters; two trials confirm he has inherited the family trait, and he has to be seriously considered.

runners.comment: Brother Cordyceps Six was smart at 5f/6f; ability in trial but needs to be sharper now
runners.spotlight: It took him a while (and some urging from the saddle) to find his stride late on in a 4f turf trial here last month; his full-brother Cordyceps Six was well beaten in this race four years ago but went on to win six times (5f/6f), including in a Group 3 handicap; worth a close look and certainly one to keep in mind in future.

runners.breeder: B J Lindsay Mnzm & Mrs J E A Lindsay
runners.comment: Won latest trial in the hands of Zac Purton; has shown good pace and is a leading player
runners.spotlight: Plenty of trial experience this year (4f/5f turf), showing good pace and promise along the way; won latest trial in the hands of Zac Purton who is on board again; sprinting should be no problem early in his career, but he has pretensions to stay up to 1m; major contender.

racecards.race_name: JC Echoes Of Love Fund Handicap (Class 4) (3yo+) (Course C) (Turf)

runners.comment: Eye-catching fourth on return from nine months off; down to Class 4 for first time; claims
runners.spotlight: Numbers one C&D success on his record, although that came in December 2023; returned from nine months off to be an eye-catching fourth behind La Forza over this 5f; nicely weighted on the best of his form and drops to this level for the first time; place hopes.

prev_owners.owner: Flemington Bloodstock, Yu Long Investments Et Al

runners.comment: Once placed in six Hong Kong runs; local starts don't suggest drop to 5f is a game-changer
runners.spotlight: Won in Australia (extended 7f) but yet to really establish himself since arriving in Hong Kong with one third from six outings; local efforts don't scream out that the drop back to 5f will be a springboard to success.

runners.owner: Yeung Chun Wang, Yeung Ho Wang & Yeung Chung Wang
runners.comment: More poor runs than good in 0-8 Hong Kong record; blinkers off but he's hard to predict
runners.spotlight: Inconsistency has been the hallmark of his 0-8 record in Hong Kong; first-time blinkers sparked an excellent third to Beauty Light at Happy Valley (6f) but he finished last when wearing them here last time; headgear is removed and it's difficult to place total faith in him bouncing back.

runners.owner: Edmund Ho Kwok Shing, Joe Fong Fu Yuen Et Al
runners.comment: Likely to make the running; in top form and every chance of improving on recent near miss
runners.spotlight: Despite being drawn in stall 1, he has the speed and the inclination to take the lead and cross to the stands' side rail; he's in a good run of form and despite a 2lb rise for a narrow defeat last time, remains on a good mark; place claims at least.

runners.comment: Plenty of experience in barrier trials but promise has been fairly limited; pass over
runners.spotlight: Extensively tried in barrier trials; moments or real promise have been few and far between; there is some sprinting blood in his background but it's hard to make a case for him on debut.

runners.breeder: Ms D M Cuthbert & P J Smith
runners.comment: Watching brief advised; 5f may be too sharp and his trials have been nothing to crow about
runners.spotlight: Starting out on the straight course might suit as he has not handled a bend fluently in his trials; that said, 5f does not align naturally with his pedigree profile.

runners.owner: Fung Wing Chung, Kenneth Fung King Keung Et Al
runners.comment: Bred to sprint and has shown some pace in trials; market check likely to be helpful
runners.spotlight: Better in this week's trial (up with the pace) than the two he tackled last month; both his dam and sire won over 5.5f and he showed sprinting speed in an Australian trial; worth taking a market check.

runners.comment: Plenty of trial experience but looks destined to be more of a 6f or 7f performer
runners.spotlight: Ten trials this season means he is well schooled for this debut; he has given glimpses of ability but may not be seen to best effect until tackling longer trips.

runners.owner: Victor Fong Yuen Tak & Leonard Fong Lik Man
runners.comment: Two fair trials; breeding points to him finding 5f too much of a speed test
runners.spotlight: Two barrier trials earlier in the year confirmed he has the ability to make his mark in Hong Kong; his breeding points to him finding 5f too much of a speed test and that 6f-plus will be more to his liking.

runners.comment: Won in Ireland (5.8f); ran a bit better last time; if he builds on that he has place hopes
runners.spotlight: Won his sole start in Ireland last year (5.8f); unplaced in each of his six appearances in Hong Kong (all here) but there was a hint last time that he may be near to finding his feet; this drop to 5f might just suit; headgear switched; interesting at a price.

quotes.race: Tinnakill House Maiden
quotes.quote: Falskirt couid be a horse that will do well in good handicaps. We'll take our time with him because he's a big horse and I would say he could be a very good four-year-old - Andy Slattery, trainer

runners.comment: Twice second in three C&D starts but has struggled to shine in his last three appearances
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in two of his three C&D appearances, efforts which place him on the shortlist; however, once factoring in his last three starts it becomes difficult to support him with any confidence; not too bad in a trial since his last start and the hood is removed but he still has something to prove.

runners.comment: Fair runs over 6f here as he seeks first win at seventh attempt; tries 5f for first time
runners.spotlight: Four times he has performed with credit over 6f of this course; drops to 5f for the first time and is likely to appreciate a good pace; whether he has the gears to get on terms where it counts is a concern.

runners.comment: Any natural improvement on his promising C&D third would make him a leading contender
runners.spotlight: Much improvement last time as he crossed the line a never-nearer third to Super Strong Kid and the reopposing Bingo Babe; that was his first tilt at 5f and with that effort behind him and a less exposed draw, he is one for the shortlist.

runners.owner: Charmaine Wong Kam Mei & Chan Fu Ho
runners.comment: Left behind previous efforts with a good C&D second last time; serious chance on that run
runners.spotlight: Kept on strongly to beat all bar Super Strong Kid over this 5f last month; that was far better than he has shown in five previous starts; on that evidence he has to enter the equation.

runners.comment: Ran okay last time and is now just 1lb higher than the mark from which he won in September
runners.spotlight: Earned all three career victories over this C&D; speedy sort who only folded late on over C&D last time and is now on a mark just 1lb higher than when scoring in September; place hopes.

runners.comment: Triple 6f winner at Happy Valley, where he was unplaced in all 5f starts; makes course bow
runners.spotlight: Triple 6f winner at Happy Valley; unplaced all five starts over this distance at that track; makes his course debut with no guarantee the stiffer circuit is going to reignite his flame.

racecards.race_name: Clap@JC Handicap (Class 5) (3yo+) (Course C) (Turf)

runners.comment: Good C&D winner in October but beaten three times since and badly so the last twice
runners.spotlight: There was a good deal to like about the way he tamed this C&D in October, powering clear of Beat Hollow inside the final half-furlong; he earned the 7lb rise but has been unable to cope with it at all in three subsequent runs, including heavy drubbings in his last two.

runners.comment: Won over this trip at Happy Valley but has finished unplaced on all ten starts here
runners.spotlight: Hong Kong strike-rate is not prolific with a record of 1-23 and although that success came over this distance, it was achieved at Happy Valley; he has mustered a single fourth-place finish from ten starts at this venue (twice over 6f) and that does not make a compelling read.

runners.comment: Not beaten far in fourth last time after being raised 6lb for a decisive C&D win; player
runners.spotlight: Has run well on all three appearances this year, including a narrow C&D success early last month; that earned him a 6lb higher mark and he was far from disgraced in finishing a close fourth last time; place hopes at least.

runners.comment: Every chance on his close second in January; below par last two starts and record is 0-12
runners.spotlight: Serious chance judged on his second, beaten a nose, to Country Dancer over C&D in January; that was a career best and he is back to that mark; twice disappointing since and has yet to win in 12 outings.

runners.owner: Cheung Kwok Ping, Ho Yin Sang & Tsang Kin Wa
runners.comment: Seeking first Hong Kong win; went very close last time; repeat effort would be good enough
runners.spotlight: Although he has gone 16 Hong Kong races without a win, he has improved this season; came from well off the pace last time and failed by just a short head to overhaul the reopposing The Concentration; he enjoys a 2lb pull in the weights and with Zac Purton on board for the first time, is a must for the shortlist.

runners.owner: Kwan Shiu Man,Jessica Kwan Mun Hang & Jeffrey Kwan Chun Ming
runners.comment: Capable over 6f on a sound surface; his efforts on dirt seem superior to those on grass
runners.spotlight: Two good 6f (dirt) efforts in defeat came either side of poor runs when distance (8.5f) and ground (slow) were against him; Hugh Bowman takes over from 7lb claimer Ellis Wong, although the latter was on board for both good runs; blinkers removed.

runners.owner: Chan Man Chun, James Mathew Fong Et Al
runners.comment: Running well on dirt and won well last time; has fair C&D form so a player back on grass
runners.spotlight: Visor replaces blinkers; having finished a close second in two of three previous starts, he richly deserved the first win of his career when too strong for Hinakami Kagura over 6f of the dirt course; a 7lb rise and the return to turf provide him with a much different test; in the frame all three C&D runs so remains one to note.

runners.comment: Claimed sole success on the dirt track; 0-15 when tackling turf so something to prove
runners.spotlight: Picked up the single victory on his CV in a 6f contest on the dirt track here; his record on turf is 0-15 across both venues; he has something to find with several of these on previous encounters on this surface.

runners.owner: Simon Tam Ngak Chou, Tam Hin Chi & Ray Tam Fai Chi
runners.comment: Swooped late for narrow C&D win in January; found this 6lb higher mark too much last time
runners.spotlight: Needed every yard of this 6f to gain his first win at the end of January; went up 6lb for that neck success and was never able to get on terms when beaten last month; others appeal more at these weights.

runners.comment: Won over 6f at Happy Valley last term but has been uncompetitive this season; 0-18 here
runners.spotlight: Scored over 6f at Happy Valley during the last campaign but has struggled to be competitive this term; he has managed one second place from 18 outings on this track.

prev_owners.owner: Newgate Bloodstock, China Horse Club Racing Pty Ltd Et Al

runners.comment: Although best at Happy Valley, his C&D second to reopposing Ho Ho Star puts him in the mix
runners.spotlight: Enters the debate if able to repeat the C&D effort which saw him finish a neck and a short-head third to reopposing Ho Ho Star; his best form has been attained at Happy Valley, including his recent close second to Golden Darci; despite that, he is of interest on that Ho Ho Star form.

runners.comment: One 7f run reads well but, otherwise, his CV is poor; unplaced in all five C&D runs
runners.spotlight: One piece of form on his record suggests he has the ability to be prominent in this contest (close third to Regency Happy Star over 7f two runs ago) but he is 0-17 and unplaced in all five attempts over this 6f; others preferred.

runners.comment: Glimpses of ability among his 17 defeats but remains frustrating as he fails to progress
runners.spotlight: Glimpses of ability among his 17 defeats but to date he has lacked a change of gear to put himself into real contention when the race takes shape.

runners.comment: One third over this trip from eight tries does not inspire support in the 13-race maiden
runners.spotlight: Like so many in this contest, he has yet to adorn his record with a victory; he did manage to finish third over this trip a year ago but has not built on that.

racecards.race_name: JC Campsite Reimagination Project Handicap (Class 4) (3yo+) (Course C) (Turf)

runners.comment: Has been knocking on the door recently; no surprise if he plays a major role again
runners.spotlight: Broke his maiden tag over 7f here last season and has been knocking on the door in recent starts; no surprise if he plays a major role once again.

runners.comment: Yet to match the form of his local success last season; 1lb below last winning mark
runners.spotlight: Opened his local account with a 6f dirt win last term; yet to match that form this season but now 1lb below that winning mark; not ruled out.

runners.comment: Safely held in all four local runs and hard to recommend, even with today's ease in grade
runners.spotlight: Safely held in all four local runs and remains hard to recommend, even with today's ease in grade.

runners.comment: Eye-catching second on debut; early breakthrough could be imminent
runners.spotlight: Eyecatching second on debut and backed it up with a solid fourth over C&D last month; early breakthrough could be imminent.

runners.comment: Recent trials have been slightly lacklustre; possibly best watched on debut
runners.spotlight: Charm Spirit gelding; recent trials have been slightly lacklustre; possibly best watched on debut.

runners.owner: Alan Chiu Chun Ming, Sandy Cheng Chuk Wah & W Law Chi Yin
runners.comment: Fair eighth on debut last month; should have learned plenty from that experience
runners.spotlight: Fair eighth on debut over the minimum trip last month; should have learned plenty from that experience and may take a step forward.

runners.owner: Arthur Antonio Da Silva, Betty Da Silva & Teresa Da Silva
runners.comment: Showed promise on debut; open to improvement and could be a bigger threat this time
runners.spotlight: Showed promise when fourth on debut over 5f; open to improvement and could be a bigger threat this time.

runners.owner: Cheng Wan Wai & Cheng Tsz Yan
runners.comment: Winless this term but has run well enough to suggest he can make his presence felt
runners.spotlight: Scored twice late last season; winless in ten outings this term but has run well enough to suggest he can make his presence felt.

runners.comment: Has shown glimmers of hope in trials; any significant market support must be noted
runners.spotlight: NZD$200,000 yearling; has shown glimmers of hope in local barrier trials; any significant market support must be noted.

prev_owners.owner: The Exors Of The Estate Of The Late Howard Liang Yum Shing

runners.comment: Improved on a low-key debut when fifth in February but was well held next time
runners.spotlight: Improved on a low-key debut when finishing fifth over 7f in February but was well held next time; more needed.

runners.comment: Not entirely disgraced in three outings over varying trips; still needs to find more
runners.spotlight: Not entirely disgraced in three outings over varying trips; will need to find plenty more to stand any chance today however.

runners.owner: 23/24 Benno Yung Tin Pang Trainer Syndicate

prev_owners.owner: R T Walker & S T Walker

runners.comment: Fair fourth in December but largely disappointing overall in ten local runs
runners.spotlight: Fair fourth in December but largely disappointing overall in ten local runs; very hard to recommend.

runners.owner: Mr & Mrs James Tien Pei Chun
runners.comment: Well beaten in all three starts; may need to drop in grade before becoming competitive
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in all three career starts; may need to drop in grade before becoming competitive.

runners.comment: Not disgraced on debut over C&D last month; could sneak into the frame
runners.spotlight: Not disgraced on debut over C&D last month; open to improvement and could sneak into the frame.

racecards.race_name: Hong Kong Jockey Club Community Trophy (Handicap) (Class 2) (3yo+) (Course C) (Turf)

runners.comment: Found Pattern company too hot last time but commands respect back at this level
runners.spotlight: Continues to progress with two C&D victories this year; found Pattern company too hot last time but commands respect back at this level.

runners.comment: Gained his seventh career victory in February; needs a career-best to follow up that win
runners.spotlight: Gained his seventh career victory over this trip at Happy Valley in February; needs a big career-best to follow up that success in this company.

runners.owner: Yuki Kong Yuk Ki & Patrick Kwok Ho Chuen
runners.comment: Landed a stylish hat-trick last month; 9lb rise demands more but clearly thriving
runners.spotlight: Five wins from eight this season and landed a stylish hat-trick over this trip last month; 9lb rise demands more but clearly thriving.

runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Matthew Lam Kin Hong
runners.comment: Rattled off a quick hat-trick earlier this campaign but progress has since stalled
runners.spotlight: Rattled off a quick hat-trick earlier this campaign but progress has since stalled; needs to find further improvement to get involved.

runners.owner: HK Association Of Lady Horse Lovers Syndicate
runners.comment: Front-runner who landed a third C&D success last month; faces stronger rivals today
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who landed a third C&D success last month; faces stronger rivals and a 6lb rise, but not dismissed.

runners.comment: Back in the mix in February; needs to rebound from a below-par effort last time
runners.spotlight: Made all for a C&D success in November and was back in the mix in February; needs to rebound from a below-par effort last time.

runners.comment: Group winner last season but form has dipped this term; arrives on a workable mark
runners.spotlight: Group winner last season but form has dipped this term; now on a workable mark so not one to completely ignore.

runners.comment: Dual winner over this trip at Happy Valley this season; held in this grade last time
runners.spotlight: Dual winner over this trip at Happy Valley this season; held in this grade last time so another step forward is needed.

runners.comment: Made all to break his local duck in December; respectable third since but more is required
runners.spotlight: Made all to break his local duck over 5f in December; respectable third since but more is required in this stronger field.

runners.owner: Ho Garrick Sai Man & Tam Wing Yee
runners.comment: Back on track 11 days ago; more on his plate this time round with a 6lb rise to overcome
runners.spotlight: Got back on track with a 6f win at Happy Valley 11 days ago; more on his plate this time round with a 6lb rise to contend with.

racecards.race_name: Thriving Youth Handicap (Class 4) (3yo+) (Course C) (Turf)

runners.comment: Fair fifth in October; safely held when returning from a break last month; down in grade
runners.spotlight: Posted his most competitive effort so far when fifth over C&D in October; safely held when returning from a break last month but is now eased in grade.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Race (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Buyin Buyin was strong at the finish and looked like he might get another furlong. He was workmanlike rather than spectacular but I'll take it. Hopefully we might run him in the Anglesey Stakes in a couple of weeks. I think he deserves to go and whether he is good enough we're not sure - Willie Browne, trainer.

runners.breeder: Rich Hill Thoroughbreds Ltd & L Williams
runners.owner: Hong Kong Young Owner Racing Syndicate
runners.comment: Well beaten in all three local starts; today's drop in class still unlikely to be enough.
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in all three local starts; today's drop in class still unlikely to be enough.

runners.owner: Cheung Ka Shing & Jason Cheung Cho Yee
runners.comment: Scored on his second start at Happy Valley in November; hasn't built on that success yet
runners.spotlight: Scored on his second start at Happy Valley in November; hasn't built on that success yet and needs to take a step forward.

runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Raymund Chao Pak Ki
runners.comment: Gained two victories at this venue last season; yet to recapture that form this term
runners.spotlight: Gained two victories at this venue last season; yet to recapture that form in five starts this term but now 1lb below last winning mark.

runners.comment: Hinted at his ability when a creditable fourth in January; not ruled out back in Class 4
runners.spotlight: Winless in seven local starts but hinted at his ability when a creditable fourth over 6f in January; not ruled out back in Class 4.

prev_owners.owner: Price Bloodstock Management Ltd & Farmhouse Holdings P/L

runners.comment: Safely held in all five local outings; impossible to recommend.
runners.spotlight: Safely held in all five local outings; impossible to recommend.

runners.comment: On a lengthy losing run but has hinted at a revival this season; dangerous to rule out
runners.spotlight: On a lengthy losing run but has hinted at a revival this season; dangerous to rule out off his current mark.

runners.comment: Competitive in all three career starts so far; looks posied to strike
runners.spotlight: Competitive in all three career starts so far; beaten-favourite last time but remains promising and looks ready to strike; contender.

runners.breeder: T E Luke & Waikato Stud Ltd
runners.comment: Showed some improvement when running on nicely in his latest barrier trial; consult market
runners.spotlight: Tivaci gelding; appeared to show some improvement when running on nicely in his latest barrier trial; consult market.

runners.owner: Ricky Ng Yu Chiu & To Ngo Fung
runners.comment: Narrowly beaten over C&D in February; disappointing last time so will need to bounce back
runners.spotlight: Narrowly beaten over C&D in February; disappointing last time so will need to bounce back to feature.

runners.comment: Kept on well when second over C&D here last month; no reason why he shouldn't play a role
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo who kept on well when finishing second over C&D here last month; no reason why he shouldn't play a role again today.

runners.owner: Frank Lyn Yee Chon & Ivy Lai
runners.comment: His latest run was a step in the right direction; more still needed
runners.spotlight: Yet to make a serious impact in five career starts but his latest run was a step in the right direction; more still needed.

runners.comment: Has shown glimmers of hope that a return to form is near; still needs to raise his game
runners.spotlight: On a long losing run but has shown glimmers of hope that a return to form is near; still needs to raise his game.

runners.comment: Gained fifth career win in January; held off his revised mark in this higher grade since
runners.spotlight: Gained his fifth career success over C&D in January; held off his revised mark in this higher grade since; plenty more needed.

runners.comment: Previously trained by Lane Robinson in New Zealand; offered very little in recent trials
runners.spotlight: Previously trained by Lane Robinson in New Zealand; offered very little in recent barrier trials; oppose on debut.

runners.comment: Hasn't fired this season and has been disappointing since dropping into this lower grade
runners.spotlight: Hasn't fired this season and has been disappointing since dropping into this lower grade; long way below his last winning mark.

racecards.race_name: Positive Ageing Handicap (Class 4) (3yo+) (Course C) (Turf)

runners.comment: Out of form this season and needs to turn a corner
runners.spotlight: Left Chris So after two very disappointing runs in January and there was no upturn on his recent stable debut; eased in grade today but needs to turn a corner.

runners.comment: 0-4 in Hong Kong but ran well over C&D when dropped to this grade last month
runners.spotlight: Unplaced all four Hong Kong starts but kept on well for fourth over C&D when dropped to this grade three weeks ago and is another 1lb lower today; considered each-way.

runners.comment: Went close over C&D in first-time visor last month and remains unexposed over 7f
runners.spotlight: Largely consistent since his 6f course win in September and lost out only by a neck over C&D in first-time visor last month; still unexposed over this trip and still on a workable mark; likely contender.

runners.comment: Six-time winner in Macau but a down-the-field outsider on all four Hong Kong starts
runners.spotlight: Six-time winner in Macau but a down-the-field outsider on all four Hong Kong starts (6f-7f).

runners.comment: Ex-Australian 4yo who is yet to make a splash after five Hong Kong starts (5f-1m)
runners.spotlight: Ex-Australian 4yo who is yet to make a splash after five Hong Kong starts (5f-1m); not the most obvious answer.

runners.owner: Dr Edwin Lam Chi Wan & Jason Lam Che Man
runners.comment: Makes official debut after some underwhelming trials; wears blinkers
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to a dual sprint winner; dam unplaced only start; makes official debut after some underwhelming trials; wears blinkers.

runners.comment: Has made a promising start to his career over 6f; moves up in trip today
runners.spotlight: Began career with two promising 6f runs here in January, the latter a close third, and was denied a clear passage when only seventh on latest outing; moves up in trip today and remains open to improvement.

runners.breeder: S F Bloodstock L L C

prev_owners.owner: Blueblood Thoroughbreds, B B T Beauty Is Et Al

runners.comment: Badly out of form over 7f/1m this season and very difficult to enthuse over at present
runners.spotlight: Badly out of form over 7f/1m this season and very difficult to enthuse over at present.

runners.breeder: D T Champion, Llanhennock Trust & M
runners.owner: Tong Kin Hing, Dr Francis Siu Pui Sing & Siu Miu Man
runners.comment: Bettered inauspicious debut when midfield here a fortnight ago but remains best watched
runners.spotlight: Bettered his inauspicious C&D debut when midfield over 6f here a fortnight ago but remains best watched.

runners.comment: Yet to show anything more than minor promise after four sprint runs; up in trip today
runners.spotlight: Yet to show anything more than minor promise after four sprint runs; needs combination of new trip and first-time cheekpieces to enable significant improvement.

runners.comment: Showed promise on second of his three 6f starts but is hard to predict today
runners.spotlight: Finished well for fifth over 6f here in January, his second start, but was well beaten on his next outing and it's hard to know what to expect from him on this first 7f attempt.

runners.breeder: Mrs B A & T G Spriggens
runners.comment: Creditable second from stall 14 over C&D last month; has same tough draw again, though
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden with rather mixed record; did well to take second from stall 14 over C&D four weeks ago but has the same tough draw again today; others preferred.

runners.comment: Made bold bid from the front when upped to 7f last month and is well drawn to attack today
runners.spotlight: Unplaced all six sprint runs but made bold bid from the front when third over C&D a fortnight ago and is well drawn to attack again today.

runners.owner: Sandia Yit Lau Ying Lam & Yit Kwok Leung
runners.comment: Placed over C&D in February but took backward step last time and is now 0-8
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden; suggested his turn might be near when placed over C&D in February but did not build on that performance over 1m last time and needs only to drop another 1lb to be eligible for a drop in grade.

runners.owner: Ng Tai Wing, Anson Or Yiu Wah & Henry Yeung Mun Kin
runners.comment: Ended losing run over C&D in January but younger rivals look better handicapped
runners.spotlight: Ended losing run over C&D in January and probably bettered that performance when second here the following month but his latest run was disappointing and some of the younger ones in this field look better handicapped.

runners.comment: Below form last month but largely in decent nick this season (C&D winner in November)
runners.spotlight: Below form here last month but largely in decent nick this season (C&D winner in November) and current mark is probably not beyond him.

racecards.race_name: Healthy Community Handicap (Class 1) (3yo+) (Course C) (Turf)

runners.owner: Eleanor Kwok Law Kwai Chun & Patrick Kwok Ho Chuen
runners.comment: Regularly holds his own in Group races and is sure to appreciate this ease in grade
runners.spotlight: Has modest strike-rate in recent years but regularly holds his own in Group races, and was commendable third in Group 1 Hong Kong Mile here in December; can cope with today's drop back to 7f and is sure to appreciate the ease in grade; respected.

runners.comment: Just as respectable fifth when back in a handicap last month and not yet proven over 7f
runners.spotlight: Has faced some very tough assignments this season but was just a respectable fifth of eight when back in a handicap here (6f) last month and is not yet proven over 7f; others appeal more.

runners.comment: C&D Group 3 handicap winner in January; will find this easier than recent Group 1 tasks
runners.spotlight: Progressive 5yo who took form to whole new level when winning C&D Group 3 handicap from out of the weights in January; safely held in two subsequent Group 1s but ought to pose a threat in this grade.

runners.comment: Stayed on well for fourth over 6f last month; sure to be suited by this return to 7f
runners.spotlight: Ended last season with C&D Group 3 handicap win; yet to hit top gear this term but stayed on well for fourth over 6f here last month and will be suited by today's move back up in trip.

runners.comment: Close second in C&D Group 3 handicap on seasonal debut but not in same form again since
runners.spotlight: Close second in C&D Group 3 handicap on seasonal debut in September but not in same form again since; on very good mark now and has the services of Zac Purton today but needs to get back in the groove.

quotes.race: William Hill Ripon Hornblower Conditions Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Taj Alriyadh is not a flashy work-horse at home, but he showed bits of ability and we've just been ticking over since his first run. Clifford [Lee] said he felt he's got a bit more and only ever does enough. He always looked like he was outbattling the other horse. I'd imagine we'll come back for the Listed race here at the end of the month (Ripon Champion Two Years Old Trophy) - Karl Burke, trainer.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (For Horses In Bands C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Taj Alriyadh wasn't that expensive and he has a nasty hock behind but apart from that he's perfect. Tally-Ho (stud) said the hock was no issue but cosmetically I suppose it put a lot of people off. Those Mehmas are great horses, they're tough. In his last couple of pieces of work he's just started to show us something. I thought the track or fitness might find him out today but he did it well - Karl Burke, trainer.

runners.owner: HK Football Club Horse Racing Syndicate
runners.comment: Won prestigious Classic Cup here (1m1f) last month; shortlisted on this handicap return
runners.spotlight: Improving 4yo who stayed on strongly to win prestigious Classic Cup here (1m1f) last month and was very respectable fifth in Hong Kong Derby (1m2f) three weeks later; drops back in trip for this handicap return; shortlisted.

runners.owner: Clement Ma Kang Ching, Josiah Ma Pok Man & David Ma Yeuk Lai
runners.comment: Just held on for C&D win on seasonal debut in October and has remained in good form since
runners.spotlight: Just held on for C&D win on seasonal debut in October and has remained in good form since; holds no secrets from the handicapper but will probably make his presence felt again.

quotes.race: Book Tickets Online At corkracecourse.ie Handicap
quotes.quote: Drombeg Banner won his maiden here last year on easy ground and all the family like a bit of soft ground, so I was delighted to see a little bit of rain overnight. We did run him in a Group 3 last year, we think a bit of him, and he has the makings of a nice sprinter. We'll look for something similar, or a conditions race in the weeks ahead - Ken Condon, trainer.

prev_owners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith

runners.comment: Good 1m winner in February but held since; looks vulnerable from 3lb wrong today
runners.spotlight: Back in prime form when finishing strongly to score at Happy Valley (1m) in February but last month's 1m1f run here was disappointing and he looks vulnerable from 3lb out of the weights on this drop back to 7f.

quotes.race: bet365 Esher Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: Rifleman has never put a foot wrong in his life and decided to do it there. I don't know whether he saw something. The horse just ducked and Ryan said he suddenly had no horse. That was strange - I don't bring horses to the races to do that. It was as much as a surprise to us as it was to you - John Gosden, trainer.

runners.comment: Excellent second in Classic Mile in January and has since gone close in a C&D handicap
runners.spotlight: Excellent second in prestigious Classic Mile here in January and was close third over C&D when dropped back in trip for handicap return three weeks ago; 4lb out of the weights today but still considered.

racecards.race_name: Nurturing Talent Handicap (Class 3) (3yo+) (Course C) (Turf)

prev_owners.owner: Newgate Bloodstock, China Horse Club Racing Pty Ltd Et Al

runners.comment: In the frame all four starts this season, including a very close second over C&D
runners.spotlight: In the frame all four starts this season, including a very close second over C&D; drawn on the wing today, which is not ideal, but seems very likely to give another good account.

runners.owner: Hong Kong St John Presidents Club Syndicate
runners.comment: Pushed-out C&D winner three runs ago but far too inconsistent to rely upon
runners.spotlight: Came good in Hong Kong at sixth attempt, with pushed-out C&D win in January, but two lesser efforts have followed and he's far too inconsistent to rely upon.

quotes.race: Newmarket Academy Godolphin Beacon Project Cornwallis Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: I wasn't that confident beforehand (because of the ground), but Inquisitively is a very tough horse. He took the lead and grabbed the race from the get go. When I saw three horses in line halfway through the race I was a bit worried, but as William says he breathes very well and relaxes. When he asked him to quicken up he put it to bed very nicely. I think he is a five-furlong horse, but we will probably have to try the six (furlongs) later down the line. He was sold to go to Hong Kong, but he worked very well at mine so I asked if I could run him at York. He ran at York and won, and we decided to go for one more today. I would love to keep him, but we will have to speak to the owner. You have a question mark on the Breeders' Cup obviously. It is a long way out and we will have to discuss. It is not out of the question - Kevin Philippart de Foy, trainer.

runners.owner: Dr & Mrs Johnny Ng Sai Chun Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Bryan Spong, Taryn Spong Et Al

runners.comment: Smart 2yo in South Africa last year; Zac Purton booked for Hong Kong debut; interesting
runners.spotlight: Won 6f maiden on debut in South Africa in March 2024 and was fourth in a Group 1 over that trip the following June; makes Hong Kong debut after ten-month absence but the booking of Zac Purton catches the eye; interesting.

runners.comment: Disappointing 5yo who is yet to be placed after four starts this season; revival needed
runners.spotlight: Disappointing 5yo who is yet to be placed after four starts this season; revival needed.

runners.owner: Howard Tai Wai Yin & Yim Hin Keung
runners.comment: Useful over 1m+ in Britain; looks opposable over 5f on Hong Kong debut
runners.spotlight: Looked useful over 1m+ during four-race career in Britain, but makes Hong Kong debut after a ten-month absence (has been gelded) and will probably find things happening too quickly over 5f.

runners.comment: Signed off in Singapore with 7f novice win last August;; drops in trip on Hong Kong debut
runners.spotlight: Signed off in Singapore with 7f novice win last August; well drawn for this Hong Kong debut but the drop to 5f may not be ideal.

prev_owners.owner: J B Wilson, Glentree Racing Syndicate Et Al

runners.comment: Below form at Happy Valley last month but made the frame over C&D on first two HK starts
runners.spotlight: Ex-Australian 4yo who made the frame over C&D on first two Hong Kong starts; well below that form from awkward draw at Happy Valley last month, but a recent 2lb drop is helpful and he can fare better now back over this straight 5f.

runners.comment: Made winning debut over 5f in Australia last July; of interest on this first start since
runners.spotlight: Made winning debut over 5f in Australia last July; not seen again since but it will be interesting to see how he fares on this Hong Kong debut; hood/tongue-tie added.

runners.comment: In good form over 6f and should be okay back at 5f; each-way claims at least
runners.spotlight: Largely consistent 4yo who was a 6f course winner in lower-grade company January and made the frame at this level on his last two outings; should be okay back at 5f; each-way claims at least.

runners.owner: Lau Sak Hong, Jimmy Wong Kwok Kin & Dr D L T Chak
runners.comment: Created very good impression when winning very comfortably over C&D on debut
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 3yo who created very good impression when dominating from the front and winning very comfortably over C&D on debut six weeks ago; 11lb higher in a higher-grade race today but could still be anything.

prev_owners.owner: Ms R A Fowler, M E Izatt & A R Davison

runners.comment: Placed over C&D on the last two of his five Hong Kong starts; enters calculations
runners.spotlight: Placed over C&D on last two of his five Hong Kong starts; might be reliant upon others setting a strong pace but still enters calculations.

runners.comment: Dual sprint winner in Australia but well beaten over C&D on both Hong Kong starts
runners.spotlight: Dual sprint winner when based in Australia but well beaten over C&D on both Hong Kong starts.

runners.comment: Struggled on both Hong Kong starts last month; drops in trip
runners.spotlight: Absent for a long time after his 6f Australian maiden win in 2023 and struggled on both Hong Kong starts last month; drops in trip.

runners.comment: Twice safely held in this grade since 6f Class 4 win in February
runners.spotlight: Looked as good as ever when scoring by a neck over 6f in Class 4 in February, but safely held in this grade twice since and will probably remain vulnerable at this level.

runners.comment: Finished down the field here (6f) on last month's Hong Kong/turf debut
runners.spotlight: 2-2 on Polytrack in Ireland in 2023 (6f/7f) but, following a long absence, finished down the field here (6f) on last month's Hong Kong/turf debut.

racecards.race_name: Giddyup And Switch To Fibrus Mares Maiden Hurdle

runners.comment: Well beaten in a bumper at this track on debut; visor quickly reached for; best watched
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in a bumper at this track on recent debut (started only 7/2); visor quickly reached for; surely capable of better but still best watched.

runners.comment: Third in a Naas maiden hurdle on rules bow; it's likely she will be a major player today
runners.spotlight: Placed in two of her three point starts; improved on rules debut when third in a Naas maiden hurdle (2m) earlier this month; quickly raised in trip and with improvement from that likely she will be a major player today.

runners.comment: Beaten 46l on recent debut in a maiden hurdle and can't be fancied on that form
runners.spotlight: Beaten 46l on recent debut in a maiden hurdle and can't be fancied on that form.

runners.comment: Best run over hurdles came over C&D in December; the ground was good then; major player
runners.spotlight: Point winner whose best run of three over hurdles came over C&D in December; the ground was good then so these conditions are likely to suit; rated 108 so looks a major player.

runners.comment: Cost Euro5,500 as a foal; will have to be useful to take this on debut; market check
runners.spotlight: Fifth foal; half-sister to 2m4f hurdle winner Mr Social; dam unraced half-sister to winners Keep It Cool (1m-1m6f Flat/2m-2m4f hurdle) and Top Strategy (useful 1m2f Flat/2m-3m jumps); cost 5,500euros as a foal; will have to be useful to take this on debut; worth a market check.

runners.comment: Runner-up last point start; could be capable of a big run; the market could be a guide
runners.spotlight: Best point effort came on third start when beaten 7l at Kirkistown; the winner sold for GBP100,000 since; tongue-tie on for rules debut; could be capable of a big run and the market could be a guide.

runners.comment: Lost her action early on debut at Downpatrick recently; best watched for now
runners.spotlight: Started at 200/1 and lost her action early on debut at Downpatrick recently; best watched for now.

racecards.race_name: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Placed in Listed chase; poor in two chase starts lately and questions back over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Has won over hurdles and fences in the last year, both coming on heavy ground, and ran well in defeat in Listed company over fences since; poor in two chase starts lately and questions back over hurdles even though dropping in class.

runners.breeder: Dundalk Racing Club& Mrs Barbara McCourt
runners.comment: Poor at Naas last time and has to bounce back; this better ground can help
