runners.spotlight: Yet to score on the Flat and over hurdles in 34 starts but placed lots of times; poor at Naas last time on comeback and has to bounce back; this better ground can help.

runners.comment: A hint of ability in three maiden hurdles; can do better in these conditions; check market
runners.spotlight: Flat maiden whose best run came at this venue over 1m2f; a glimpse of ability in three maiden hurdles on testing ground but is likely to do better in these conditions; handicap debut; check the market.

runners.comment: Modest Flat maiden has a shout on handicap hurdle debut if repeating debut run
runners.spotlight: Modest Flat maiden was a fine third on hurdling debut at Killarney last August; well below that level twice after but has a shout on handicap debut if repeating that.

prev_owners.owner: Global Bird In The Hand Syndicate
Global Bird In The Hand Syndicate

runners.comment: Hasn't matched bumper form over hurdles, including handicaps; needs improvement
runners.spotlight: Placed in first two bumper starts on testing ground last season; hasn't matched that level over hurdles in six starts, including handicaps; needs to find improvement.

runners.comment: Poor on three of last four hurdle starts; needs a return to her best after an absence
runners.spotlight: Record of 1-21 over hurdles and was poor on three of last four starts in this sphere; needs a return to her best after an absence.

runners.comment: Pulled-up at Wexford on return; needs massive improvement; tongue-tie added
runners.spotlight: Not much to show for four maiden hurdle starts, including when pulled-up at Wexford on return; needs massive improvement even dropping to handicaps; tongue-tie added.

racecards.race_name: Fast As Fibrus Broadband Novice Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Not a bad effort on debut for this yard in a 2m maiden hurdle; this trip will suit better
runners.spotlight: Has been running in points over the winter, runner-up twice; not a bad effort on debut for this yard in a 2m Clonmel maiden hurdle; this trip will suit better; cheekpieces tried; due to run in the 3.15 Bellewstown Saturday.

runners.comment: Below form last start but has a shout if ready enough on return; ground suits
runners.spotlight: Dual Flat winner won a Worcester maiden hurdle (2m) last September before a solid Listowel handicap run over 2m4f; below form next start but has a shout if ready enough on return; ground suits.

quotes.race: Betway Handicap
quotes.quote: Brilliant Light was coming back from a mile and a half and I wanted to bowl along, but he didn't have the speed. He needed every yard of that mile and a quarter. He's a big, strong horse who wants good ground and he coped with today fine - he wouldn't want to be running somewhere with firm in the description - Hector Crouch, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: Lightly raced all-weather and turf winner who impressed on his first three starts in Britain but got rather stuck in the mud on his last outing. We see him as a progressive type who should do well on a sounder surface. He could reappear in the Listed Zabeel Turf on January 28 and work his way up the ratings thereafter. 20-01-21

runners.comment: Poor on slow ground and hasn't jumped well in two chase runs latest; chance if rebounding
runners.spotlight: Won a Downpatrick maiden hurdle last autumn and a solid handicap run there next time; poor on testing ground since and hasn't jumped well in two chase runs either; a chance if bouncing back.

quotes.race: Downpatrick Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Tell Nobody Nothin travelled great. He had a break over the summer and I'm thrilled with him. We'll take it steady, we'll look for a rated novice with him or something like that - Noel Meade, trainer.

runners.comment: Has a chance if back to the level of some of his better early efforts
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose maiden has been well beaten on his last two hurdle starts but has a chance if back to the level of some of his better early efforts.

runners.comment: Running well enough at times lately mixing hurdles and fences; squeak if repeating best
runners.spotlight: Maiden after 22 starts but has been running well enough at times lately mixing hurdles and fences; handles this ground and has a squeak if repeating best form; due to run in the 7.17 Ballinrobe Friday.

runners.comment: Detached when falling at Leopardstown last time; visor needs to work
runners.spotlight: Best hurdle run came at Clonmel in January over 2m4f; poor next time and detached when falling at Leopardstown since; visor needs to work.

runners.owner: John Paul Flynn & P J Rothwell
runners.comment: Beaten 11l last two starts over shorter; might find more raised in trip on better ground
runners.spotlight: Not bad efforts when beaten 11l last two starts in soft ground over 2m and 2m3f; might find improvement raised in trip on better ground after a break.

racecards.race_name: Fibrus Says Neigh To Price Hikes Handicap Hurdle

runners.owner: G King & Nick Courtney & Joe Murphy & Conor Brett
runners.comment: Point winner, promise in Thurles maiden, disappointed on h'cap debut, capable of better
runners.spotlight: One of two for yard; heavy ground point-to-point winner is 0-5 over hurdles, best effort a neck second in a Thurles maiden (2m4f, good to yielding) early last month; disappointed on handicap debut at Downpatrick last time over this trip; down 1lb and still early days for her; capable of better.

runners.breeder: M Pierre Lecoq & M Augustin Lecoq
runners.comment: Poor form over hurdles so far, disappointed on h'cap bow, better ground now, hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; expensive purchase has so far failed to live up to his price tag; yet to finish closer than 27l to the winner in four runs over hurdles; no sign of improvement in first handicap at Navan (2m4f, heavy); could improve for better ground but hard to fancy.

stable_tour.quote: He's better than the bare form. He was just a bit weak last season, but he's much stronger now and you'll see a different side to him. 28-10-24

runners.comment: Won off 88 last June, satisfactory effort off revised mark of 96 after break, chance
runners.spotlight: Is 1-12 over hurdles, the win coming off 88 at Downpatrick last June (2m6f, good); given a break afterwards and posted satisfactory effort on return over the same C&D two weeks ago when a 9.25l fourth off 96; should strip fitter now; chance.

quotes.race: Randox (Q.R.) Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: I didn't think he'd get beaten today. I'm chuffed for the owner. I trained the dam to win for me as well. I thought Kalsman would need the trip. We'll keep him to these sort of races, and keep him local, as he doesn't travel well - Liam Lennon, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.comment: Point winner, promise in maidens on testing ground, may have needed latest, interesting
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner on yielding to soft is 0-5 over timber; showed promise in maidens at Limerick and Punchestown at 2m4f-2m7f on testing ground; brother won on good so should handle the ground and shaped as though the run was needed on latest; interesting.

runners.comment: 0-19 over timber, beaten 32l off 3lb higher latest, tongue tie and visor on, hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Long standing maiden under Rules; 0-12 in chases and 0-19 over hurdles; won a point-to-point last October but hasn't looked like a winner in waiting and was beaten 32l on latest at Limerick; down 3lb and tongue tie-visor combo now tried; hard to make a case for on recent form.

runners.comment: H'cap debut, half-brother won over 2m7f on good ground, potential improver, check market
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutant; best maiden effort came here over 2m4f but was still beaten 32l; half-brother won over 2m7f on good to firm so conditions and trip should suit; potential improver worth a market check.

runners.comment: 0-15 over hurdles, 2m3f an inadequate test latest, this trip more suitable, leading chance
runners.spotlight: Is 0-15 over hurdles but has run well in defeat, including when a 6.5l fourth of 16 on latest over an inadequate 2m3f at Limerick (raised 2lb); stepping up to this trip will suit, good ground is fine and he holds leading claims.

runners.comment: 0-5 over hurdles, promise on stable and h'cap bow here last month, 2m6f should suit
runners.spotlight: Is 0-5 over hurdles; huge odds all five starts; glimmer of promise here on handicap and stable debut last month over 2m4f (good) when a 9.5l seventh of 19, shaping as though further would suit; could go well.

runners.owner: T Leopold, P Smith, D P Connolly & C Connolly
runners.comment: 0-10 over hurdles, iffy jumping in chase latest, 4lb lower over timber, must jump better
runners.spotlight: Is 0-10 over hurdles; suffered misfortune when unseating at Thurles and Wexford last month but didn't jump well in a handicap chase at Wexford on latest; reverts to hurdles off 4lb lower mark and is capable of better if his jumping improves.

runners.comment: 0-7 over hurdles, hasn't improved for h'caps, beaten 127l on latest, hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Is 0-7 over hurdles; huge odds and poor form in maidens on testing ground at 2m; no sign of improvement in handicaps over longer trips; beaten 127l on latest at Fairyhouse in January; down 3lb and better ground here but hard to fancy after that last run.

runners.comment: 0-9 over hurdles, stayed on over 2m4f here latest, claims if building on that up in trip
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 9yo is 0-9 over hurdles; best effort to date over timber on latest here (2m4f, good) when running on from the back for a 5.5l fourth of 19; same mark here and should relish the step up to 2m6f; claims if he can build on that effort.

runners.comment: Point winner in January, pulled up in that sphere latest, can only be watched after that
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner is yet to win under Rules; 0-11 over hurdles and pulled up in a point on latest start at Oldtown in February; can only be watched on the back of that effort.

runners.comment: Much-improved on h'cap debut on latest when backed, good ground should suit, claims
runners.spotlight: Maiden pointer is 0-4 over hurdles; big odds and well beaten in maidens at 2m-2m1f; the money came for her at Limerick on her handicap debut when upped to 22.5f (yielding) in first-time cheekpieces (retained) and she ran much better to finish a 12l fifth of 18; may improve further for good ground; claims.

racecards.race_name: Fibrus Gallop At Gigabit Speeds Beginners Chase

runners.comment: Beaten 17l on chasing debut but that was a stronger race than this; yard's second-string
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner is rated 128 but was below form in that sphere on last two starts; beaten 17l on chasing debut but that was a stronger race than this; seems yard's second-string, though.

stable_tour.quote: He won his only point-to-point at Dromahane and jumped particularly well there so I've no doubt he will turn out to be a better chaser than hurdler. He'll start off in a beginners' chase soon. 28-10-24

runners.comment: Pulled-up (8/13 fav') on chasing debut at Gowran last October; has the ability but risky
runners.spotlight: Point winner won two bumpers and two hurdles; however, lost his form dramatically in the last 18 months (not many runs); had an injury when pulled-up (8/13 fav') making chasing debut at Gowran last October; has the ability to win but risky.

quotes.race: Trustatrader Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Encanto Bruno was keen quite early and jumped a few big but travelled very strongly. He surprised me to be honest, although he goes well at home he's a far better racehorse than he is work horse. He's versatile, he could come back to two (miles) and he's a lovely horse to look forward to and he'll be exciting when he jumps a fence - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Price Boosts All Channels Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: The plan is Cheltenham later on this year and I think Encanto Bruno will stay well - John McConnell, trainer.

quotes.race: Spirax-Sarco Engineering Sustainability Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB)
quotes.quote: This is an important one as we thought Encanto Bruno was very good. He's done everything right at home along the way and the race wouldn't have been run to suit with a slow pace all the way. He's a baby and he was spooking at the screen going out and coming back in but he looks a proper horse. He's only a 4yo so I'd say we'll probably leave him in bumpers because there's a whole life ahead of him. He hasn't had much of a break since we've got him so we'll probably give him a holiday now and come back in the spring for a nice race. He's going to be a nice jumper in time - John McConnell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won a novice hurdle nicely at Cheltenham last month. He travelled strongly over two and a half miles there, nearly a bit too strong, and overjumped a few. He looks versatile as he could definitely come back in trip. I'm not sure he's as ground-dependent as people think, so we might try him on soft ground and see how he gets on - I wouldn't rule out going for the Royal Bond as I think he can make his mark in Graded races. He jumps very well and is one to look forward to when we send him over fences. 10-11-23

We got him after he won his point-to-point at Ballynoe 12 months ago and he has done himself proud. We took him to Cork for his first run in a bumper and he won that, but he was even more impressive when a good four-length winner at Cheltenham in November. We sent him back for the festival but the soft ground blunted his speed. He's a possibility for Aintree or Punchestown and then we may go hurdling in the summer with him. He jumps well and looks a nice hurdling prospect. 06-04-23

runners.owner: Mrs M Roden & Mrs R Nolan
runners.comment: Grade 2 winner; the one to beat if chasing re-ignited the spark and cheekpieces might help
runners.spotlight: Classy Flat and hurdle type, winning twice at Grade 2 level including at this track; lost form on his last four starts and beaten 22l at Leopardstown on comeback; would be the one to beat if chasing re-ignited the spark and cheekpieces might help.

quotes.race: WKD Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Pied Piper idles in front and we didn't want to make the running, but he just cantered around like it was a piece of work. We'll probably wait till Christmas now - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Masterson Holdings Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was a nice way to start Pied Piper off and it was great. He's got a lot stronger since last season and I love the way he put his head down and galloped to the line. He's a nice horse. We're going to dream for another while but it's a hot division and he'll have to keep improving. We'll go to Down Royal now for the WKD [Hurdle] in two weeks time then onto Christmas from here. He'll be trained as a Champion Hurdle horse but it's a very hot division and he's going to have to improve but if you're not in, you can't win. As an individual he's way stronger. Even going round the ring he looked more like a chaser than a juvenile. With them juveniles you want that scope to keep improving. It's as strong as a division as there is out there. We can go to bed dreaming tonight anyway - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: JCB Triumph Trial Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Finesse) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We thought we'd come over, have a feel and see where we are. We thought Pied Piper was a nice horse and if he was settled and behaved he's go close. We thought he was nice, but I was surprised a little bit by that. He jumped like a man. When he got close to one he learned how to settle. We bought him as a horse to mix on the Flat and over jumps, so he'll be a nice horse for those staying Flat races as well this year. He looks nice. They've (Fil Dor) got the same owners so we may try and split them up, we might run the two of them in the Triumph Hurdle. They're both in the Supreme Novices', I'd say this is the speedier horse than the other one and the Friday track might suit Fil Dor better. If one of them is going to go for the Supreme then it'd be this lad. There's always Aintree and plenty of other options. I wouldn't rule the Supreme out for him - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Join Tote.ie 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Pied Piper is a nice horse and I think there is an awful amount of improvement in him. I couldn't see him winning today and he hasn't even been away from home. He jumped well and probably travelled a bit too well early. He loved the ground and is one to look forward to. He's a big baby - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Kube - Leicester's Premier Event Hire Venue Handicap
quotes.quote: Pied Piper has been travelling a lot better in his races recently and been caught too far back off a slow pace the last twice. We went an even gallop considering the conditions and he kept at it well. He won in similar conditions at Newmarket at the back end of last year and has replicated the timing again this year - Rab Havlin, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: It looked a nice opportunity for him at Punchestown, but he got tired having travelled strongly and fell at the last. That was obviously disappointing, but he's talented on his day and he's finished second and third in the last two County Hurdles. Maybe we might try to make that third time lucky. He seems to like Cheltenham. 28-10-24

runners.comment: Struggling on Flat and over hurdles recent starts and can't be fancied on chasing debut
runners.spotlight: Usually races keenly and races in front; struggling on Flat and over hurdles recent starts and can't be fancied on chasing debut.

quotes.race: Peter K. Hits The Big 50 (Q.R.) Handicap
quotes.quote: Wrecking Ball Paul went very well and I didn't actually realise how much of a gap there was until I came round the home bend. I knew then I had lots of horse left under me and I wasn't too worried. Paul (Mulligan, trainer) said to get a breather into him and I gave him one down the back, but I didn't realise how far ahead I was - Kevin Healy, jockey.

quotes.race: Axa Farm Insurance Midlands National Day Friday 14th July Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Wrecking Ball Paul has been knocking on the door,. He is a bit of a headcase and needs settling down but Ben Harvey is a seriously good jockey, he did exactly what he was told. He ran at Listowel yesterday and it just took the edge off him - Paul Mulligan, trainer

runners.comment: Has run well enough at times over fences but plenty to find against the principals today
runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdle winner has run well enough at times over fences but has plenty to find against the principals today.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Shane gave Miss Oreo a great ride. She's free and I told him to try and save a bit so that you'll be able to give her a breather at some stage. Her jumping was unreal. She won a point-to-point and any of them that win a point-to-point can jump. Shane has done a lot of work with her at home because she's not an easy ride, so fair play to him - Shark Hanlon, trainer.

racecards.race_name: Fibrus Super Simple To Switch Handicap Chase

runners.comment: Gained first chase win in Limerick h'cap latest, up 6lb, quicker ground fine, more to come
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the third attempt over fences on latest at Limerick (24.5f, yielding to soft); hit with a 6lb rise for that and will encounter quicker ground here but she ran well on good to yielding in a beginners here back in December (20.5f); could be more to come.

stable_tour.quote: A nice mare we like. She ran well the other day at Cork and finished a long way clear of the third. We think there'll be more to come from her when she steps up in trip. The further she goes, the better she'll be. 20-11-23

runners.comment: Won at 2m6f over hurdles, 0-5 in chases, stamina to prove, others make more appeal
runners.spotlight: Winning hurdler is 0-5 in chases but has run well in defeat, including at this venue over 16.5f (good to yielding) back in January; won at 2m6f over hurdles but has stamina to prove for this trip; doesn't look a certain stayer on breeding and others appeal more.

runners.comment: 1-7 over fences, poor latest, good ground a plus, ran well here before, interesting
runners.spotlight: Sole win a 20.5f beginners chase at Kilbeggan (good) last May; hasn't yet cut much ice in handicaps and was well beaten in a novice chase over this trip at Fairyhouse latest (behind Meyo), though soft ground wasn't ideal; could improve back on better ground and has run well at this venue before; interesting.

runners.comment: H'cap chase debut, good run latest, strip fitter now, ground fine but lacks experience
runners.spotlight: Good ground maiden hurdle winner is 0-2 over the bigger obstacles; best effort yet in this sphere on latest when a 1l second of four in a novice at Fairyhouse (3m2f, soft); should strip fitter now and she'll enjoy this quicker ground, though her lack of experience is a worry on handicap chase debut.

quotes.race: Dairygold Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Meyo is still green and backward. She learned plenty at Galway last day in a race that's working out well. We thought she would run a nice race today - Darragh O'Keeffe, rider.

runners.comment: 3-24 in chases but winless since August 2021, out of form after layoff, others preferred
runners.spotlight: Is 3-24 in chases; last won in August 2021 at Kilbeggan; well-handicapped on that form but she hasn't shown enough in two starts back from a long absence to make her of interest here; others preferred.

quotes.race: Newcastlewest Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Fairyhill Run is real good mare and she'll go straight for the Blazers at Galway next. She's high class - John Ryan, trainer.

quotes.race: Ballykisteen Hurdle
quotes.quote: Fairyhill Run is a savage mare. She might go back over fences and I think she will win a good mares' chase - John Ryan, trainer.

quotes.race: Patrickswell Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Fairyhill Run is a lovely mare and she will be way better over fences. She's a lovely scopey mare. She's a fast jumper and a real galloper, we will keep her to novice company for now - John Ryan, trainer.

quotes.race: Bluegrass Horse Feed Novice Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I think The Little Yank might have won if he wasn't hampered and Fairyhill Run ran a cracker. She's a talented mare and will stay to pattern races. The Little Yank is coming back to where he was last year - John Ryan, trainer of Fairyhill Run and The Little Yank

quotes.race: McHale Fusion 3 Range Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: She's a nice mare, a winter type. She's just a galloper and was big and weak last year. I had a very good mare in Mystery Stowaway that I lost recently and this one has the potential to be another - John Ryan, trainer of Fairyhill Run

runners.comment: 1-9 over fences, shaped well here in January, ground too soft last twice, could rebound
runners.spotlight: One of two for yard; 1-9 over fences; won a Clonmel beginners last June (2m7f, good); ran a decent race here in a 3m handicap chase back in January (good to yielding); struggled both starts since (well behind Meyo latest) but testing ground not ideal; could rebound on this sounder surface.

runners.comment: 1-12 over fences, good second off this mark over 3m here in January, could make a bold bid
runners.spotlight: Is 1-12 over fences; 8l ahead of Sea Aster when a 0.5l second of 10 here over 3m in January and races off the same mark here; outclassed over C&D latest; this more suitable and this front-runner could make a bold bid.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Marronstown stays very well and it was good to see him handling this ground. I think the penny is only dropping with him now. He has taken a long time to mature, he has put in three good runs now which he has not done before - David Christie, trainer.

runners.comment: Point winner, 0-8 in chases, beaten 22l in Ulster National, this easier but needs more
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner is 0-8 in chases; went close at Fairyhouse off 3lb higher in January (2m5f, yielding to soft); weakened and beaten 22l in Ulster National at Downpatrick latest (28.5f, good); this easier but more needed.

racecards.race_name: Fibrus Total Home Wi-Fi Handicap Chase

runners.owner: Paul M Butler & James Patrick Byrne
runners.comment: 0-6 in chases, pulled up last chase start, tame hurdles effort after break, opposable
runners.spotlight: 1-25 over hurdles but remains a maiden over fences after six runs; pulled up latest start in this sphere last August; given a break subsequently and returned with tame effort over hurdles at Naas; may need another run or two to hit top form.

stable_tour.quote: He ran nicely at Aintree and for quite a while I've had the £100,000 long-distance hurdle in mind for him at Haydock on Saturday. The time has come to go up in trip to 3m. He was second in the EBF Final at Sandown last season and that's always a good race. 16-11-21

runners.comment: 1-16 over fences, went close on penultimate, outclassed latest, chance back in this grade
runners.spotlight: 1-16 in chases, the win coming off 88 at Limerick (24.5f, soft) in March 2023; went close back at that venue in this grade on penultimate off 87 (2m7f, good); struggled upped in class latest from out of the handicap but this is more suitable; claims.

quotes.race: Agritech Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Made In The Woods is a grand horse at this grade. He is a lovely horse for soft ground and three miles. He might go back over hurdles now. There are more days in him but at his own grade - Norman Lee, trainer.

runners.comment: Point winner on testing ground, poor form at big odds under Rules, watch on h'cap debut
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner on testing ground; no impact under rules yet; pulled up in a hunter chase at 33-1, tailed off in a beginners when 200-1 and similar story in a Grade 3 Navan novice latest; best watched on handicap debut.

runners.comment: Four-time hurdles winner, 0-19 over fences, lacks a run, others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Four-time winning hurdler is 0-19 in chases and rated 7lb lower in this sphere; ran well at Tramore and Kilbeggan last year but he lacks a run and his record when fresh is poor; others appeal more.

quotes.race: Dunloe Hotel & Gardens Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I was hoping it wasn't going to come too soon after Tramore and Paul said he idled in front. He loves that good ground and wants a trip. He'll be a nice staying type next year and if the ground is good he'll go to Listowel for a staying handicap hurdle. We might then put him away for next year - Shay Barry, trainer

quotes.race: Gain (C & G) Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: He missed all of last season due to a hoof injury. It's great that he's after coming back with a grand couple of runs and Barry [Geraghty] gave him a great ride - he thought he'd got there even though it was tight. He stays well and comes from a good staying family. We'll probably be hitting Galway now. A novice hurdle early in the week is a possibility - Shay Barry, trainer.

quotes.race: Tramore (C & G) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: He's a chaser really but we'll go hurdling now. He hated the ground the last day and even though he's quite big he liked this. He's a nice horse - trainer Shay Barry.

runners.comment: 0-11 under Rules and 0-2 in chases, beaten 50l after break latest, hard to make a case for
runners.spotlight: 0-11 under Rules and 0-2 in chases; minor promise in maiden hurdles but has been disappointing so far in handicaps; beaten 50l at Limerick on return from an absence latest when 33-1; difficult to make a case for.

runners.comment: Placed in points, poor form in three chase starts, can only be watched on h'cap chase bow
runners.spotlight: Placed in point-to-points and a remote third in a maiden hurdle at Limerick his best run under Rules; 0-3 in chases and has failed to beat a rival when completing; can only be watched on handicap chase debut.

runners.comment: Two-time hurdles winner, 0-10 in chases, ran well here last April, probably needs it soft
runners.spotlight: Two-time winner over timber on soft ground; 0-10 in chases and rated 9lb lower in this sphere but hasn't looked like a winner in waiting on most recent chase starts; beaten 38l in a handicap hurdle at Naas latest; did run well here over 2m4f last April but he would prefer softer ground.

quotes.race: Easter Festival 3rd - 5th April Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Tangental coped with that ground well and when I asked him he took off and did the job well. He might be able to win another one and he'll jump a fence in the summer time - J.J. Slevin, rider.

runners.comment: Point winner, 0-9 in chases, changed yards after heavy point defeat last month, watch
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner is 0-12 under Rules and 0-9 in chases; left Neil McCluskey after heavy defeat in a point-to-point at Lougbrickland last month; best watched on first run for new yard.

runners.comment: Veteran is a three-time soft ground winner, has won here over shorter, place claims
runners.spotlight: Veteran is 3-42 over fences; all three wins on soft ground, the latest in May 2022; has won over 2m1f here but his third here on his penultimate start over 20.5f was a remote one; beaten 22l here over that trip latest; stepping back up in distance will suit; place chance.

quotes.race: Follow Fairyhouse On Social Media Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: School Lane seems to be improving. Sam (Ewing) gave him a lovely ride. Hopefully he'll go to the Ulster National at Downpatrick - Liam Lennon, trainer

runners.comment: 13yo is 0-8 over fences, has run okay the last twice, place chance in a weak race
runners.spotlight: 13yo veteran has won twice over hurdles; is 0-8 in chases but has shaped with a bit of promise the last twice; has run well over timber here before; probably vulnerable to younger legs for win purposes but he has a definite place chance.

quotes.race: Protect Your Smartphone With Zagg Maiden Stakes
quotes.quote: Important Message had every chance at Bath and we were a bit disappointed, but he's a big, raw horse with plenty of scope. Stepping up in trip helped, although it was more like a mile-and-a-quarter race as we went slow and then it was a dash - James Doyle, jockey.

racecards.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Maiden Hurdle

runners.comment: Solid level of of form in maidens; more needed here with penalty for bumper win
runners.spotlight: Bumper win on good ground (Limerick) last May sandwiched between two promising maiden hurdle efforts (hooded) at Wexford and Downpatrick; solid effort early this month in 2m1f Limerick maiden, although ran a bit in snatches (no hood) when third; more needed here to play a leading role with penalty to carry.

runners.comment: Never sighted, pulled up on debut 9 days ago at Wexford when hooded (now left off)
runners.spotlight: Cheaply bought Wings Of Eagles mare was never sighted, eventually pulled up on debut nine days ago at Wexford when hooded (now left off).

runners.comment: Points' winner but both outings under rules have been poor
runners.spotlight: Won a mares' maiden point-to-point in December but both rules' outings poor, latest in Gowran maiden last month.

runners.comment: Beaten long way in midfield in better-class maidens; better ground should suit
runners.spotlight: Fair third in bumper here last summer (good); midfield in both maiden hurdles when beaten a long way; drops in class here though.

runners.comment: Beaten a long way in both maidens this time last year, including here; hooded on return
runners.spotlight: Beaten a long way in both maidens this time last year, including here; tried hooded now on return.

runners.comment: Big price purchase has become frustrating but this looks her best chance yet
runners.spotlight: Changed hands for a massive 500,000 euros after a wide-margin point win two seasons ago and although 0-6 over hurdles has shown a consistent, decent level of form at 2m-2m4f; not progressive but a reproduction of her better efforts could well be sufficient here back in maiden company.

stable_tour.quote: We've given her plenty of time since she was third in a Listed bumper at Navan last November. We might go back to that same bumper with her next month. She's improved plenty. I like her. 28-10-24

runners.comment: Likely winner when fell at the last at Listowel last June; runs well fresh, big player
runners.spotlight: Twice placed in bumpers and maiden hurdles, including over C&D this time last year (yielding); looked set to get off the mark when falling at last in 2m Listowel maiden last June and hasn't been seen since; runs well fresh, definite contender.

runners.comment: Some promise at Naas of late; more needed but place claims
runners.spotlight: Has changed stable twice this season, merit in her Naas bumper run in November and not discredited in maiden hurdle there 10 days ago; place claims.

racecards.race_name: QuinnBet Maiden Hurdle

prev_owners.owner: Poetry In Motion Syndicate/Gavin Cromwell Racing Limited

runners.comment: Danish Flat winner; encouraging recent hurdles debut at Thurles; could well play a role
runners.spotlight: Dual Danish Flat winner had been absent for 579 days until staying on into mid-division (only beaten 7l) in 2m Thurles maiden hurdle last month, a mistake two out not helping his cause; likely improver here and could well play a role.

runners.comment: Better Flat performer; placed in handicap hurdles, more needed here though
runners.spotlight: Four-time Flat winner at around 1m but now 0-12 hurdling, couple of placings in handicaps; midfield finish in Irish Lincoln (Curragh) last month wasn't a bad effort; don't rule out.

quotes.race: KONE Handicap
quotes.quote: San Aer loves that ground. He's a very honest little horse and has won here before. He might go to the Curragh on Sunday - Tom Mullins, trainer

runners.comment: Modest but effective Flat handicapper; well held both hurdle runs last summer
runners.spotlight: Three Flat wins including at Dundalk over the winter and good second there last month; well held both hurdle outings last summer (including here) and may be of more interest when tackling handicaps.

quotes.race: Silver Shine Turf Services Ltd Handicap
quotes.quote: I was lucky to pick up Hastily for 1,000gns, but she's a very big girl. It's a similar story with Coffeemeanscoffee, I suppose ? I picked her up for just 800gns. You need to be patient with these big-framed horses ? some of the bigger yards aren't - Tom McGuinness, trainer.

runners.owner: Sean H Reynolds & E J O'Grady
runners.comment: Fair Flat handicapper likes good ground; saddle slipped on recent rare hurdles run
runners.spotlight: Experienced Flat handicapper with two wins on good ground last summer; saddle slipped on rare hurdles run at Naas recently.

runners.breeder: M Julien Lebrun & M Anthony Pierre Yves Lebrun
runners.comment: Won't have to be too special to make a winning debut here, market should be informative
runners.spotlight: Buck's Boum 5yo cost 60,000 euros as a 3yo; second foal; dam French 1m2f Flat and 2m4f/2m5f chase winner; won't have to be too special to make a winning debut here, market should be informative.

runners.breeder: S C E A, Haras Du Hoguenet,E A R L Ecurie Prevost Baratte,M
runners.comment: Half-brother to 1m5f AQPS Flat winner Jinor; market best guide on debut
runners.spotlight: No Risk At All gelding is second foal; half-brother to 1m5f AQPS Flat winner Jinov; dam placed French 2m1f hurdler, sister to 2m-2m1f hurdle/chase winner Contre Tous; market best guide on debut.

runners.comment: Half-brother to State Man showed promise in bumpers earlier in season; likely major player
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to State Man showed promise in bumpers at Punchestown and Leopardstown earlier in season when forcing pace; likely no world beater but introduced over hurdles at a realistic level here.

stable_tour.quote: A half-brother to State Man who was second in the bumper at Punchestown on Sunday. He just got tired in the closing stages, but was still a long way clear of the third. He will need to improve on that, but I think he can. 25-11-24

runners.comment: Beaten 20l+ in two bumpers last summer; can only be watched on hurdles debut
runners.spotlight: Beaten 20l+ in bumpers at Ballinrobe and Roscommon last summer; can only be watched on hurdles debut.

runners.comment: Has looked limited on the Flat and two hurdle runs haven't offered much; tried hooded
runners.spotlight: Has looked limited on the Flat and two hurdle runs haven't offered much; tried hooded now but hard to fancy.

racecards.race_name: Adare Manor Opportunity Maiden Hurdle

runners.comment: Pulled up in both points and on last month's bumper debut; tongue-tied for hurdles debut
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in both point-to-point starts and again on last month's bumper debut; tongue-tie fitted for hurdles debut.

runners.comment: Cork maiden second in October and recent bumper run should have brought him on; claims
runners.spotlight: Some promise in three bumpers, okay comeback effort at Naas 10 days ago; better form when close second in 2m5f Cork maiden hurdle last October on good ground which would give him place claims here.

runners.comment: Never better than midfield in recent 2m Naas maiden; longer trip may suit
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to point winner Peeping Tom; unraced dam; never better than midfield in recent 2m Naas maiden; longer trip may suit.

runners.comment: Clonmel comeback run was below her best; entitled to come on for it but still has it to do
runners.spotlight: Exposed at this stage after 11 attempts hurdling and last month's Clonmel comeback run was below her best; entitled to come on for it but still has it to do.

runners.breeder: Mrs T K Cooper & Miss Diana Cooper
runners.owner: Mrs T K Cooper & Miss Diana Cooper
runners.comment: Good recent 2m handicap form; looks the one to beat if staying this much longer trip
runners.spotlight: Promising run in first-time tongue-tie when third in Naas maiden in November and good efforts since in 2m handicaps, clear second at Naas and outpaced from last by a ready winner in Navan mares' contest last month; steps up markedly in trip here and looks the one to beat if staying.

runners.comment: Clonmel third was encouraging; unproven over this far but good chance she'll stay
runners.spotlight: Winning point-to-pointer is 0-8 over hurdles but took a step in the right direction at Clonmel last month when third (Ashdale Flyer 10l away) to a stablemate, having made much of the running; unproven over this far but good chance she'll stay.

runners.comment: Okay debut run in Wexford bumper last August; trip to suit but best watched on hurdles bow
runners.spotlight: Mount Nelson filly; dam unraced half-sister to high-class bumper and 2m4f-3m hurdle/chase winner No More Heroes, out of unraced half-sister to high-class jumpers Celestial Gold and Fiveforthree; just okay debut run in Wexford bumper last August; trip should suit but best watched on hurdles debut.

runners.comment: Stoutly-bred debutant; likely all the better for the experience
runners.spotlight: Mount Nelson mare; fourth foal; dam unraced half-sister to bumper/useful 2m-2m7f hurdle Vieux Lille and prolific hunter chaser Bon Accord, family of high-class chaser The Listener; hooded for debut and can only be watched.

racecards.race_name: QuinnBet Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Good fifth in 2m4f Punchestown maiden (soft); could be well treated on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Point winner on testing ground; well beaten either side of good fifth in 2m4f Punchestown maiden (soft) but could be well treated on handicap debut if able to run close to that form.

runners.comment: Dual winner whose best form is at around 2m; okay runs this spring but trip is a concern
runners.spotlight: Dual winner on soft and heavy ground and best form at around 2m; couple of okay runs this spring but trip is a question mark.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Seamus had Kalanisi Dubh in great form, she was very fresh and came on plenty from the last day. She was great and it's great to do it for a small owner and trainer. This is my first double and a huge day for me - Niall Moore, jockey.

runners.comment: Course bumper winner was quiet in maidens but can't be ruled out on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Useful form in bumpers including course victory in 2023; quiet runs in maidens last autumn but couldn't be ruled out here on handicap debut; cheekpieces added.

runners.comment: Second to in-form rival over this trip at Limerick (heavy) in January; well held since
runners.spotlight: Point winner on nice ground a year ago; best hurdles run when close second to in-form rival over this trip at Limerick (heavy) in January; well held since.

runners.comment: Placed in pair of handicaps over further and better for return from 10 months off at Cork
runners.spotlight: Third when gambled-on favourite for C&D maiden a few years ago; still winless but placed in a pair of handicaps over further and better for return from 10 months off at Cork when only 5-1.

runners.comment: Ran well in course maiden and placed on handicap debut over 3m at Wexford last year
runners.spotlight: Ran well in course maiden last summer and placed on handicap debut over 3m at Wexford next time; not as good since but unexposed and and better for last month's comeback over 2m.

runners.comment: Flat winner not had many goes hurdling; well held in two recent Limerick 2m3f handicaps
runners.spotlight: Flat winner not had many goes over hurdles; well held in two recent Limerick handicaps over 2m3f.

runners.comment: Locally-trained 4yo ran well in a couple of maidens on good ground; longer trip may suit.
runners.spotlight: Locally-trained 4yo ran well in a couple of maidens on good ground in the autumn; soundly beaten in first handicap but down in grade and longer trip may suit; tongue-tie tried last time stays on.

runners.comment: 2m6f winner has been placed around here; better for last month's outing after a layoff
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced since making the breakthrough over 2m6f a couple of years ago; has been placed around here and better for last month's outing after seven months off.

prev_owners.owner: N Campion & Mrs T Stone Brown

runners.comment: Maiden has been out of action since fair effort over similar trip here in early 2023
runners.spotlight: Maiden ran creditably a few times in her younger days but has been out of action since fair effort over similar trip here in 2023.

runners.comment: Soundly beaten thrice, despite market strength, since placed effort over 2m6f; blinkers
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten thrice, despite market strength, since his placed effort over 2m6f (soft) in January; visor didn't work in the past, blinkers now tried.

runners.comment: Goes well here; better effort when last seen and could go okay with cheekpieces added
runners.spotlight: Sole win came in chase here in the autumn and has also run well in C&D hurdle contest; better effort when last seen and could run well with cheekpieces added.

runners.comment: Tricky customer won on AW off lowly mark just before Christmas; hurdles form is dire
runners.spotlight: Tricky customer won on AW off lowly mark just before Christmas; hurdles form is dire.

runners.comment: Fair bumper runs early on but didn't show much in first two starts for new yard last year
runners.spotlight: Maiden not had much racing; couple of fair bumper runs early on but didn't show much in first two starts for this yard last year.

racecards.race_name: QuinnBet.com Handicap Chase

runners.comment: Not shamed in first-time blinkers in Down Royal beginners last month but more needed
runners.spotlight: Hasn't really progressed over fences; good run behind Jazzy Matty over similar trip at Sligo in October but not much since; not shamed in first-time blinkers in Down Royal beginners last month but more needed.

quotes.race: Cawley Furniture Novice Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Digby toughed it out and is a real stayer. He will jump a fence. We'll see how he comes out of this but I'd say we will go to Punchestown if there is something suitable - Dermot McLoughlin, trainer.

quotes.race: Killarney Plaza Hotel Rated Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Richie said Digby is a grand horse, is still a bit raw and said they went a good gallop. He said he knew from the bottom of the straight he had them covered and he stays going well. Winter ground is an unknown but has been running on quick ground and that's the softest ground he has run on yet. He has been on the go a while but we'll see what the boss man (owner Pat Conway) wants to do. He'll jump fences next year - Dermot McLoughlin, trainer.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De Faydeau
runners.comment: C&D beginners' winner is likely better than he has shown in first two handicaps
runners.spotlight: Won three times last year, including C&D beginners' contest in November; first handicap chase at Leopardstown was a write-off (badly hampered) and likely better than he showed last time; handles decent ground or softer.

quotes.race: Eddie McDonald Outstanding Contribution Award Winner 2024 Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Jouster doesn't do a lot when he gets there. He jumped better today and things went a bit smoother. That's about his level - Keith Donoghue, rider.

runners.breeder: S C E A Elevage De Clermont
runners.comment: Second after five months off at Limerick; stays this far and has run well around here
runners.spotlight: Dual chase winner made good return to action after five months off when second at Limerick (2m2f); stays this far and has run well around here.

runners.comment: Touched off in 2m4f Down Royal beginners' chase but not built on that yet; handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Dual point winner is maiden under rules; touched off in 2m4f Down Royal beginners' contest at Christmas but hasn't built on that since; handicap debut.

runners.comment: Second in valuable 3m novice handicap at Navan was career best in this sphere; up 5lb
runners.spotlight: Three wins over hurdles, including here, and very consistent in handicap chases without getting his head in front yet; latest second in valuable 3m novice handicap at Navan was a career best in this sphere; got 5lb for that.

quotes.race: John Kiely Special Recognition Award Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Cheerful Chap was a little bit green in front today but he's going to keep improving so hopefully we'll have another go - Conor Brassil, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

runners.comment: Loves it here and won this last year off 7lb lower; also won over hurdles here in January
runners.spotlight: Loves it here and won this last year off 7lb lower; also won over hurdles here on New Year's Day; well held last time but very much respected back at his favourite venue.

quotes.race: Hospitality At Festival 2023 Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Rochestown got a great ride from Ambrose. He just idled a bit going to the last. Hopefully we can find another similar race - Brendan Walsh, trainer.

runners.comment: Prominent racer in fine form both hurdling and chasing; second in latest chase, 3lb higher
runners.spotlight: Prominent racer in fine form at present, adding Downpatrick hurdles win last time to Navan chase victory in March; in between was second off 99 on latest chase start, now 3lb higher.

quotes.race: NavanRacecourse.ie Mares Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Lilian Bland not winning out of turn and has been to every rodeo this year. Over hurdles, she always seems to bump into a wicked, well-handicapped one. We saw this race coming up a few months ago and when the handicapper dropped her one pound, she was in on rock bottom and I said 'lovely'. She's not the easiest to ride and can be wicked keen, but Richie [Deegan] is the most underrated rider in the country - Niall Hennessy, trainer.

quotes.race: Well Done To Our Irish Cheltenham Winners Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Lilian Bland got the ground she wanted. It's been bottomless wherever we have gone but she likes that sort of heavy ground. It's loose. We'll tip away for as long as we can and see what happens - Niall Hennessy, trainer.

racecards.race_name: QuinnBet.com Rated Novice Chase

runners.comment: Second in mares handicap latest over 2m5f; drop in trip and quicker ground may not suit
runners.spotlight: Won Grade 2 hurdle at Fairyhouse over 2m two years ago; 0-5 chasing this term, best efforts when second in 2m2f Limerick novice and under top-weight in 2m5f Navan mares' handicap last month when clear second to a decisive winner on heavy; back markedly in trip here on quicker ground which may not be ideal.

runners.comment: C&D novice win on New Year's Day not working out but loves it here so respected
runners.spotlight: Took a long time to register a first hurdles win, doing so in 2m handicap here in October (yielding) and showed liking for the track when landing C&D novice chase on New Year's Day on heavy (form not working out); more likely needed here but relishes this circuit and has to be respected.

runners.comment: Thurles run encouraging; possible improver off 7lb lower than hurdles mark
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdles winner as a 4yo but on a long losing streak; only second attempt chasing when fourth in decent Thurles mares' beginners last month and possible improver here off 7lb lower than hurdles mark with tongue-tie now tried.

quotes.race: KPMG Hurdle
quotes.quote: Media Naranja is really tough and stays galloping so I made plenty of use of her and her jumping is very good. She's straightforward and honest and hopefully will keep going in that direction - Corey McGivern, rider.

stable_tour.quote: She had some decent snippets of form over hurdles and she might be even better over fences. I wouldn't read too much into her chasing debut at Tipperary as she kept being hampered by a loose horse. 28-10-24

runners.comment: Never sighted on recent chase debut in strong Wexford beginners, hard to be confident in
runners.spotlight: Four-time hurdles winner over 2m on varying types of ground; never sighted on recent chase debut in strong Wexford beginners and hard to be confident in locally-trained 8yo.

quotes.race: Hotel Park St. Johann In Tirol Austria Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Clarens was second last year and it was in my mind to come back here. He was well in with Alex Harvey's claim and we got there in time. He loves it here and we might look for something else here - John Flavin, trainer.

quotes.race: Navan Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I would say Clarens learnt more today than ever before because he was shuffled back further than we wanted, and to be fair to Jack [Foley], he sat with him and had to come wide. Thankfully he jumped the last well and stayed going. It was lovely. He's improving all the time. Today was the plan, but there is a novice handicap in Leopardstown on St Stephen's Day and we might go there - John Flavin, trainer.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Clarens is a lovely little horse that has taken time to come to himself. I told Jack to ride him good and positive and he jumped very well. I was hopeful of a good run - John Flavin, trainer.

runners.comment: Navan second reads well; better ground no problem either, should go well
runners.spotlight: 23-race maiden under rules, including second in 2m maiden hurdle here last summer; best effort over fences on latest when clear second to an improver in 2m1f Navan handicap last month on soft; has form on better ground too; should go well.

racecards.race_name: SETU Student Race Day Tomorrow April 14th Handicap Chase

runners.comment: Chase debutant has been off five months; twice runner-up in handicap hurdles in September
runners.spotlight: Chase debutant has been off five months; twice runner-up in handicap hurdles in September and merits respect despite the layoff and his lack of experience over fences.

runners.comment: Won this last year and nearly always shows up well at this track; lacks a recent run
runners.spotlight: Won this last year when with Philip Rothwell and nearly always shows up well at this track; made winning stable debut at Thurles in November and fair third there the following month; lacks a recent run but reckon he'll be primed for this.

runners.comment: Placed twice hurdling; chase career has started with two non-completions, fancied latest
runners.spotlight: Placed twice in handicap hurdles over 2m4f/2m6f; chase career has started with two non-completions at Thurles; money for him last time (only 9-2) so may be capable of better.

runners.comment: Back to last winning mark; couple of fair runs after winter break, trip too far last time
runners.spotlight: Seven wins, three of them over fences; latest win was at Downpatrick last summer and back down to same mark; couple of fair runs after winter break and 2m5f was too far last time; course record not the best.

quotes.race: Daily Jackpots At BoyleSports Vegas Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Ricky Langford wants good ground. He has a similar mark over fences and he could go for a handicap chase before the summer is out - Philip Rothwell, trainer.

runners.comment: Moderate chase form for Eric McNamara; lightly raced over hurdles for this yard
runners.spotlight: Hurdles winner long time ago but moderate chase form when with Eric McNamara; lightly raced over hurdles for this yard, just one good effort when placed at Limerick in 2023; off over a year.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Blackjack Boy is a nice horse, hopefully a horse that can keep improving and being by Presenting he likes some nice ground - Eric McNamara, trainer

runners.comment: Point winner ran okay on handicap debut over 2m3f at Wexford; this trip may be too sharp
runners.spotlight: Modest maiden over hurdles, placed off 89 over 2m5f last summer; point winner in January and ran okay on recent handicap chase debut over 2m3f at Wexford; this trip might be too sharp.

runners.comment: Second over C&D in October but well held since; may have needed Limerick reappearance
runners.spotlight: Second over C&D in October but well held since; may have needed recent Limerick reappearance but modest enough strike-rate and Prince Of Air looks the yard's main hope; tongue-tie left off.

quotes.race: Wexford Welcomes Racing TV Members Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Coole Arcade was very good. Stepping back to 2m suited him. He was good and slick the whole way in his jumping and having something to aim at helped a lot - Rachael Blackmore, rider.

quotes.race: Follow Us On Facebook Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We were always hoping he would be able to do that. Cool Arcade has been knocking on the door once or twice. It's really good for Pimlico Racing (owners) as they have a few horses in the yard - Rachael Blackmore, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He fell at Naas on Saturday but he's had a good year. She won two and was placed as well. He'll go on a break now and return in the spring. 14-11-22

runners.comment: Hurdles winner off 83 well held in that sphere lately; no impression on sole chase start
runners.spotlight: Won 2m1f hurdle off 83 last summer; well held in that sphere lately and made no impression on sole chase start at Clonmel in November.

runners.comment: Modest but was second in Cork hurdle last summer; poor chase form and back from a layoff
runners.spotlight: Modest maiden in all codes although was second in Cork hurdle last summer; chase form is poor and back from a layoff.

racecards.race_name: Oka Sho (Japanese 1000 Guineas) (Grade 1) (3yo Fillies) (Turf)
